Job Description:
An Oracle Core DBA (Database Administrator) is a professional responsible for the installation, configuration, maintenance, and optimization of Oracle Database systems
They play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation and performance of Oracle databases within an organization
Here are some key responsibilities and tasks typically associated with an Oracle Core DBA:Database Installation and Configuration: Oracle Core DBAs install and configure Oracle Database software on servers or systems
They ensure proper setup, including configuring database parameters, creating database instances, and establishing connections to client applications
Database Maintenance and Monitoring: DBAs perform regular maintenance tasks, such as database backups, recovery, and applying patches or updates
They monitor database performance, identify bottlenecks or issues, and take corrective actions to optimize performance and ensure high availability
Database Security and User Management: DBAs implement and maintain database security measures, including user authentication, role-based access control, and data encryption
They manage database users, roles, and privileges, ensuring that access is granted according to the organization's security policies
Database Performance Tuning: DBAs analyze and optimize database performance by monitoring and fine-tuning various aspects of the database, such as query optimization, index creation, and memory management
They use performance monitoring tools and techniques to identify and resolve performance bottlenecks
Backup and Recovery: DBAs implement and manage database backup and recovery strategies to protect critical data
They design backup plans, perform regular backups, and test the restore processes to ensure data integrity and minimize downtime in case of failures or disasters
Keywords: Performance tuning, query optimization, Monitoring tools, Memory management, database security, data integrity, Database maintenance, Database Administrator, User management, Performance monitoring

further refining the physical design to meet system storage requirements
install and test new versions of the database management system (DBMS)
maintain data standards, including adherence to the Data Protection Act
write database documentation, including data standards, procedures and definitions for the data dictionary (metadata)
control access permissions and privileges
develop, manage and test back-up and recovery plans
ensure that storage and archiving procedures are functioning correctly
carry out capacity planning
work closely with IT project managers, database programmers, and multimedia programmers
communicate regularly with technical, applications, and operational staff to ensure database integrity and security
commission and install new applications and customize existing applications in order to make them fit for the purpose
manage the security and disaster recovery aspects of a database.
Keywords: Data dictionary, metadata, Front end, HP data protector, data security, Disaster recovery, DBMS, Troubleshooting, Physical design, Capacity planning

Job Description:
Job Description
Oracle Customer Success Services is a One Oracle approach to ensuring customer success, through a broad set of services and solutions that are supported by certified and experienced implementers, helping to accelerate the entire customer journey. Customer Success Services provides a customer-centric delivery and support-integrated service, in conjunction with Oracle Development. As an advanced database support engineer of customer success service organization, you will be responsible to deliver support and services on database, engineered systems and cloud technologies to our premium customers. The support and services covers the entire life cycle of the product starting from architecture design, implementation, optimization, maintenance etc. The role involves working with the customers and ensure they get the best out of our products.
Requirements:
- Minimum 10 Years experience as an Oracle database engineer/DBA
- Very thorough and clear understanding of Oracle Database Architecture
- Extensive experience in Golden Gate replication
- Sound knowledge of cloud

RAC, ASM, Performance tuning, Data Guard Golden Gate etc.
- Experience in troubleshooting various installation and patching issues
- Expert level skills database migrations, patching and upgrade
-Experience in Oracle engineered systems like Exadata, ZDLRA
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
- Ability to work under pressure - quick thinking and remaining calm during stressful situations.
- Willingness to work in shifts and on weekends.
- Ability to quickly grasp complex technical issues.
- Appetite to learn new technologies and constantly improve technical skills.

Position Type: Intern

Job Description:
Database Installation and Configuration: Install and configure Oracle Database software, ensuring it meets specific requirements and performance goals
Database Design: Design and create database schemas, tables, and objects based on business requirements
Database Maintenance: Regularly perform database maintenance tasks such as backups, patching, and data optimization to ensure system integrity and performance
Data Security: Implement and manage security measures, including user access control, encryption, and auditing, to protect sensitive data
Performance Tuning: Monitor database performance, diagnose and resolve issues, and optimize query performance to ensure efficient data retrieval
Backup and Recovery: Establish and manage backup and recovery strategies to protect data and ensure business continuity in case of system failures
High Availability and Disaster Recovery: Set up and manage high availability solutions, such as Oracle RAC (Real Application Clusters), and disaster recovery solutions to minimize downtime
Database Monitoring: Continuously monitor database systems using Oracle Enterprise Manager or other monitoring tools to detect and address issues proactively
Query Optimization: Optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database design for improved performance
Capacity Planning: Estimate and plan for future database growth and resource requirements
Keywords: Performance tuning, query optimization, Database design, data security, Disaster recovery, Oracle DBA, Oracle RAC, Stored procedures, Capacity planning

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Oracle Database Administrator (DBA) to join our team.
As a Senior Oracle DBA, you will be responsible for ensuring the performance, availability, and security of Oracle database systems.
You will play a critical role in designing, implementing, and maintaining our database infrastructure, as well as providing technical guidance and support to junior DBAs and developers.
The ideal candidate should have extensive knowledge of Oracle database management, strong problem-solving abilities, and a proactive approach to database administration.
Responsibilities:
Should be open to work in flexible shifts.
Install, configure, and upgrade Oracle database software and related tools.
Design, implement, and maintain highly available and scalable Oracle database systems.
Proficiency in performance tuning, capacity planning, and troubleshooting Oracle database systems.
Implement and maintain database security, including access control, data encryption, and backups.
Develop and enforce database standards, guidelines, and best practices.
Collaborate with application developers to design and optimize database schemas and SQL queries.
Plan and execute database backup and recovery strategies.
Perform regular database maintenance activities, such as database tuning, index rebuilds, and statistics gathering.
Troubleshoot and resolve database-related problems and incidents in a timely manner.
In-depth understanding of Oracle database architecture, internals, and features.
Familiarity with backup and recovery techniques, such as RMAN and Oracle Flashback.
Experience with Oracle Real Application Clusters (RAC) and Data Guard.
Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
At least 10 years of experience as an Oracle DBA in a senior or lead role.
Keywords: Oracle database, Performance tuning, database security, Database administration, Oracle DBA, Troubleshooting, Information technology, RMAN, Capacity planning

1> Installing oracle server and client software, creating, upgrading.

15 years of full-time education

7 10 years of experience on Oracle Administration.

Programming Language

Domain

Soft skills required:
Communication : Database administrators must explain complex ideas in clear and concise terms as part of reports and recommendations. They also provide assistance to users and management
Organization : Data that is organized logically and effectively is easier for users to access, leading to better database performance
Analytical : Analyzing large amounts of data and determining which data is relevant is an integral aspect of database administration
Creativity : It may be necessary for database administrators to be creative and innovative in order to develop new procedures for collection, storage, security and application.
Business-Focused : A keen understanding of business objectives and strategies is a vital aspect of determining appropriate database administration policies and procedures
Problem-Solving : Troubleshooting accounts for a large part of a database administrator s functions. These professionals can be tasked with resolving issues related to data integrity, backup and cybersecurity, with the goal of preventing data loss and mitigating database malfunction

As a Tech lead Oracle Database Admin (DBA), you will be responsible for database administration, design, development, and support applications available systems. You will be responsible for continuously enhancing the automation process of the database and should have an interest in DevOps to help us improve our software engineering practices. You will be required to work closely with multiple stakeholders in order to understand their database needs. After understanding their needs, you will make recommendations and provide self-services offerings that will allow stakeholders to deploy, monitor, and maintain the correct databases for their business.
You will work with fast-paced, skilled team of engineers and developers across multiple high-profile projects. You will also participate in IT projects from inception of the project up and through the daily maintenance phase of a project. You should have good understanding of cloud concepts. If you are a top-notch Database Engineer and looking for the next challenge, apply now!
Core Requirements and Responsibilities:
Essential job functions included but are not limited to the following:
Primary Skill: Oracle DBA, Secondary Skill : PostgreSQL DBA
Required: Experience with Oracle database administration , deployments both on-premises and AWS
Experience in installing and upgrading Oracle 19c databases
Experience with RMAN database backup and recovery.
Skilled in Linux Shell Scripting, Ansible, Splunk and/or Python.
Resolve complex problems by investigating and devising solutions for database operations. May include installations, configuration, tuning and maintenance of database management.
Hands-on end-to-end Database Development encompassing Database Design and Development working with cross-functional teams.
Implement High Availability database solutions in Oracle.
Develop automation frameworks (Infrastructure as code, CI/CD pipelines) and tooling that will be consumed by the entire engineering organization.
Understand the business priorities and requirements; architect/develop solutions to meet the business need and lead execution.
Experience with automation, Ansible, Python, Terraform is a plus
Provides after-hours and weekend support and participate in on-call rotation (24X7)
Skills/Requirements
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
4+ years of experience in Oracle administration and automation/scripting experience supporting production environment
Production support experience for critical Oracle database systems
2+ years of AWS RDS and Aurora cloud experience preferred
1+ years of DevOps experience preferred
Develop new performance monitoring solutions
Experience with Oracle database backups and recovery
Familiarity with standard tools and platforms that enable continuous delivery such as GitLab, Octopus Deploy, Kubernetes and ServiceNow.
Possesses good oral and written communication skills.
Contributes to a positive team environment.
Enjoys finding and implementing solutions to new challenges.
Proactively asks questions and learns about our products.
Effectively multi-tasks and adapts to change.
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting abilities.
Ready to learn other core database technology like Postgres, MS SQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, and other open-source databases.
Additional Requirements and Details:
Travel required up to 10% of the time.
Located and working from an office location.
Occasional lifting and/or moving up to 10 pounds.
Frequent repetitive hand and arm movements required to operate a computer.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision (working on a computer, etc.).
Frequent sitting and/or standing.
Keywords: Automation, Linux, Database design, Postgresql, Shell scripting, Database, splunk, Oracle, RMAN, Python

Job Description:
Oracle Certified DB Professional (OCP) with more than 8 years experience with Oracle Database Administration, preferably in a senior IC role. Experience should include DB design (modelling and normalization), capacity planning, performance tuning, storage management, back-up and recovery, managing schemas, report generation, support and operations and DB clustering technologies
Strong practical experience of ORACLE in a production RAC (ASM) environment
Experience with an organization with a key reliance on 24x7 reliability on its database
Creates and maintains all databases required for development, testing, education and production usage
Performs the capacity planning required to create and maintain the databases. The DBA works closely with system administration staff
Plans and implements backup and recovery of the Oracle database
Controls migrations of programs, database changes, reference data changes and menu changes through the development life cycle
Performs database re-organizations as required to assist performance and ensure maximum uptime of the database
Puts standards in place to ensure that all application design and code is produced with proper integrity, security, and performance. The DBA will perform reviews on the design and code frequently to ensure the site standards are being adhered to
Evaluates releases of Oracle and its tools, and third party products to ensure that the site is running the products that are most appropriate. Planning is also performed by the DBA, along with the application developers and System administrators, to ensure that any new product usage or release upgrade takes place with minimal impact
Provides technical support to application development teams. This is usually in the form of a help desk. The DBA is usually the point of contact for Oracle Corporation
Enforces and maintains database constraints to ensure integrity of the database
Administers all database objects, including tables, clusters, indexes, views, packages and procedures
Troubleshoots with problems regarding the databases, applications and development tools
DBA should possess a sound understanding of the business
DBA should have sound communication skills with management, development teams, vendors, systems administrators and other related service providers

A Good knowledge of the Unix Operating system(s)
Hands on experience on monitoring the performance/tickets tools like OMI, Service Now, Toad
Ability to install, configure on ORACLE DBA Clustering and fix support packs on all OS platforms
Have or experience in other RDBMS like MS SQL, MySQL
Must be a self-starter with a strong attention to detail
Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise:
Proficient in working with high availability environment along with alignment to process (ITIL)
You love collaborative environments that use agile methodologies to encourage creative design thinking and find innovative ways to develop with cutting edge technologies
Ambitious individual who can work under their own direction towards agreed targets/goals and with creative approach to work, individual with an ability to manage change and proven time management
Proven interpersonal skills while contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
Up-to-date technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications

Job Description:
DBA/ AWS Services/ DataGuard Replication/Unix/Linux
Shift: Rotational 10:00 AM - 1:00 AM (Midnight)
Job Summary:
We are seeking a skilled Oracle Database Administrator (DBA) with a strong background in cloud computing to manage and optimize our Oracle database systems in a cloud environment
The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in Oracle database administration, as well as a solid understanding of cloud platforms and services
As an Oracle DBA with a Cloud background, you will be responsible for ensuring the availability, security, performance, and scalability of our cloud-based Oracle databases
Responsibilities:
Deploy, configure, and maintain Oracle databases in a cloud environment (eg, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure).
Monitor database performance, identify bottlenecks, and optimize query performance to ensure efficient operation.
Implement and maintain database security measures, including access controls, encryption, and data masking, to protect sensitive information.
Plan and execute database backups, recovery procedures, and disaster recovery strategies in the cloud.
Work with development and infrastructure teams to design and implement database architectures that align with cloud best practices.
Collaborate with application developers to optimize database schema, queries, and indexes for cloud-based applications.
Monitor and manage database storage to ensure optimal usage and cost efficiency in the cloud environment.
Implement and manage database replication and clustering solutions to achieve high availability and fault tolerance.
Perform database upgrades, patches, and migrations in the cloud environment.
Maintain and enforce database policies, procedures, and standards to ensure compliance with data governance and regulatory requirements.
Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues and coordinate with vendor support when necessary.
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in Oracle database technologies and cloud computing to propose and implement improvements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to plan and execute database-related projects in the cloud.
Provide guidance and mentorship to junior DBAs and technical staff on database and cloud-related topics.
Requirements:
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience as an Oracle Database Administrator, with a minimum of [X] years of hands-on experience managing Oracle databases.
Strong knowledge of Oracle database architecture, performance tuning, backup and recovery, and security.
Solid understanding of cloud computing concepts and experience with cloud platforms (eg, AWS, Azure, GCP, OCI).
Familiarity with cloud database services, such as Amazon RDS, Azure SQL Database, or Oracle Autonomous Database.
Experience in cloud infrastructure setup, configuration, and management for Oracle databases.
Knowledge of database monitoring and management tools in the cloud.
Understanding of high availability, disaster recovery, and backup strategies in a cloud environment.
Proficiency in SQL and PL/SQL scripting for database administration tasks.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex database issues.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Preferred:
Oracle DBA certification (eg, Oracle Certified Professional - Database Administrator).
Cloud-related certifications (eg, AWS Certified Database - Specialty, Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate)
Keywords: Unix, Performance tuning, Cloud computing, Linux, Disaster recovery, Database administration, PLSQL, microsoft, Information technology

Job Description:
Key Responsibilities:
Oracle Applications Administration:

Manage, configure, and administer Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) environments, including installation, patching, and upgrades.
Monitor the health and performance of Oracle EBS, resolving issues and ensuring optimal system uptime.
Collaborate with functional teams to support and troubleshoot Oracle Applications modules.
Database Administration:

Administer and maintain Oracle databases, ensuring data integrity, security, and availability.
Perform database installations, upgrades, patching, and migrations as needed.
Monitor and tune database performance, optimizing SQL queries and database configurations.
Backup and Recovery:

Implement and maintain database backup and recovery strategies.
Conduct regular backup testing and ensure data recoverability in case of failures.
Security and Compliance:

Implement security measures and access controls to protect sensitive data within Oracle Applications and databases.
Ensure compliance with data security and privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR).
Performance Tuning:

Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in Oracle EBS and databases.
Optimize database configurations, indexes, and query performance.
Patch Management:

Keep Oracle Applications and databases up-to-date with the latest patches and security updates.
Plan and execute patching activities with minimal downtime.
Documentation and Knowledge Sharing:

Create and maintain comprehensive documentation related to Oracle Applications and database configurations.
Share knowledge and best practices with team members and stakeholders.
High Availability and Disaster Recovery:

Implement and maintain high availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) solutions for Oracle Applications and databases.
Conduct regular DR testing and ensure failover readiness.
Keywords: Oracle, Oracle Application Database Admin, Oracle Apps, R12, RAC, Cloning, OTM, Oracle DBA, Oracle RAC, Apps DBA, Oracle E-business Suite

Job Description:
The E-Business DBA will support E-Business Suite Upgrade. He will contribute to all the technical aspects of the E-Business suite upgrade project. In this position he will perform upgrade, issue resolution and collaborate with other technical members of the team to carry out the project requirements and deliverables. The ideal candidate will reflect a mix of qualities: effective communication, technical proficiency and the ability to work effectively with technology partners and other internal customers to provide responsive support across our application portfolio.
DETAILED RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES:
Improve E-Business Suite Upgrade Process to reduce the downtime.
Work with Dev team & Support technical issues arises because of the upgrade.
Clone Database & E-Business Suite for Upgrade.
Patch & upgrade E-Business Suite env.
Document Upgrade Steps & known issues which can be reference for subsequent iteration.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Skills:
Strong knowledge Database Administration tasks (configuration, sizing, space management, monitoring, patching, upgrades, performance tuning, troubleshooting and administration.).
Strong knowledge and application of ORACLE APPS Database administration tasks (adadmin utility, patching, concurrent Managers, users and responsibilities, code promotion, index rebuilding, configuration etc).
Expertise in Oracle EBS Release 12.2 (or higher) technical architecture, including knowledge of underlying database architecture, with particular reference to schemas/products, database objects, file system structure, tables, views, packages, procedures, functions, triggers, sequences, indexes and constraints .
Broad knowledge of and experience with WebLogic application server, including configuring, troubleshooting and tuning
Practical experience with advanced topology elements like shared APPL_TOP, Oracle Cluster ware, Rapid Application Cluster (RAC) and Automatic Storage Management (ASM).
Good UNIX/Linux knowledge and good automation (UNIX/Linux scripting).
Consultant must have performed duties such as installing, upgrading, and supporting (patching, troubleshooting, tuning).
Oracle EBS software and associated Oracle Technology stack in multi-tier / multi-node / multi-platform environment, comprising database server, applications server, web server, concurrent processing server, reports server, forms server, admin server, and discoverer server.
Systems Analysis and Performance Tuning (Oracle Database 12c/19c, WebLogic, Oracle Application Server, JVM Tuning, Application SQL and PL/SQL code tuning, etc.)
Review existing configurations and installations and provide design decisions for improvements to platform environments.
Work with Oracle vendor and its respected support channels when required.
Work with multiple application teams and developers to troubleshoot technical issues.
Experience :
5+ years recent practical experience as Oracle EBS DBA, demonstrating 2+ years sustained period of performance on previous 2 most recent assignments.
Education :
B.E. in Computer Science or M.C.A.
Principles & Related Competencies:
Ethical
Complies with policies and procedures; Takes the high road and upholds our values; Maintains confidentiality; Acts with integrity, honesty and respect.
Collaborative
Works cooperatively with others offers and accepts help; Freely shares information as appropriate; Open to and willing to provide feedback; Strong contributor to the team s results; Celebrates the individual and the team; Ability to clearly communicate.
Looks Beyond Oneself
(Team Player) Demonstrates humility and willingness to recognize and give credit to others; Works well alongside people of different backgrounds and ideas; Builds good relationships with others; Values Distributors and teammates.
Drives Innovation
Add value through: Proposing ideas and creative solutions to employee, distributor and/or customer challenges; Listening to and respecting others ideas through collaborating and helping develop those suggestions; Driving ideas forward to implementation.
Delivers Change :
Delivers Change Through: Adapting to different working environments; Responding positively to change including new duties and assignments

Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY STATEMENT:
The Oracle Apps Database Administrator will have primary responsibility for the operation of Oracle Business Suite 11.5.x and non-Oracle Applications Oracle Databases. This role and the responsibilities of this role are critical, comprehensive, and include, but are not limited to, database server installations, Oracle Apps and Middleware technology products installations and management, schema updates, data migrations, tech upgrades, patches, user maintenance, troubleshooting, backup management, performance tuning, table space management, data recovery, and disaster recovery planning. The ideal candidate will reflect a mix of effective communication, technical proficiency, application maintenance ownership, and the ability to work effectively with other business and technology personnel and internal customers to provide very responsive support to Client Oracle Platform based application.

Provide Shift and non-shift support for Oracle E-Business Suite, Oracle production, test and Development Instances.

Utilize core database skills to maintain key processes like archiving, monitoring, replication, integrity and security.
Implement and test disaster recovery plan.

Work well in a cooperative environment that fosters knowledge sharing

Job Description:
The Hybrid Cloud SQL Database Administrator (DBA) is responsible for managing and maintaining both on-premises and cloud databases, ensuring their performance, security, and availability. The primary focus of this role is on MS SQL Server and cloud-based databases, with secondary expertise in Oracle databases. The DBA collaborates with cross-functional teams, including product engineers, software developers, and application mangers, to ensure efficient database operations.

The ideal candidate for this role will have IT infrastructure experience in both Cloud and On-premises database administration.
Note: Because the role is part of a global team, the candidate must be able to work in shift model.
  Task and Responsibilities:
  Database Support: Provide support and administration for MS SQL Server databases and Cloud databases. Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues and incidents, including performance problems, connectivity errors, and data inconsistencies.
Database Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance by analyzing query execution plans, index usage, database statistics, and other performance indicators. Identify and resolve bottlenecks and performance issues to ensure optimal database response times.
Database Security: Implement and enforce security measures to protect the organizations databases from unauthorized access, data breaches, and data loss. Configure user access permissions, roles, and privileges based on the principle of least privilege.
Database Backup and Recovery: Develop and maintain backup and recovery strategies to ensure the integrity and availability of the organizations data. Perform regular backups, test restore procedures, and implement disaster recovery plans to minimize data loss and downtime.
Database Monitoring and Maintenance: Monitor database health, availability, and capacity to proactively identify and resolve potential issues. Perform routine maintenance tasks such as database reorganization, index rebuilding, and database statistics updates.
Database Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for database configurations, schemas, procedures, and processes. Document database changes and update data dictionaries to ensure accuracy and clarity of database-related information.
Database Upgrades and Patching: Plan and execute database software upgrades and apply patches to ensure database systems are up to date with the latest security fixes and performance enhancements. Coordinate with system administrators and vendors for a smooth upgrade process.
  Qualifications:
  Overall 5+ years experience as Database Administrator.
Bachelors or masters degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.
Experience with Azure cloud.
Relevant industry certifications, such as Microsoft Certified Database Administrator, etc. is a plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Technical skills
Strong expertise in MS SQL Server database administration, including performance tuning, security, and backup and recovery.
Proficiency in cloud-based database technologies, such as Microsoft Azure SQL Database, Microsoft Azure SQL Managed Instance and CosmosDB, including deployment, configuration, and performance optimization.
Familiarity with Oracle database administration, including installation, configuration, performance tuning, and backup and recovery is a plus.
Solid understanding of database concepts, SQL, and query optimization techniques.
Knowledge of database security principles and best practices.
Experience with database monitoring tools and performance analysis.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex database issues.
Excellent documentation and communication skills.
Keywords: Computer science, Performance tuning, MS SQL, Usage, query optimization, database security, Disaster recovery, Database, Information technology, SQL

Job Description:
We are looking for a Database Admin Senior Advisor colleague with a dynamic personality and helpful attitude to join our Database Engineering team; where either the complexity is high, or deep technical knowledge of our products is required. We value technical design skills, programming ability, and teamwork. Being able to design applications from top to bottom, troubleshooting and debugging tough problems, and brainstorming new ideas are important to this role. You will be working primarily with Ruby, Rails, and Javascript, but our general approach is to choose the best language for the job. We utilize PostgreSQL for storage, and we use RabbitMQ and RESTful APIs for communication between our various services. We employ continuous integration for testing and deployment.
Responsibilities
- Work closely with the team members and leaders as well as the business teams. Delight them with your ability to provide solutions to their needs
- Maintain the health and effectiveness of the platform over time
- Provide day-to-day support and troubleshooting with on-call support. Full lifecycle application development support - designing and debugging applications DB functionality
- Understand and anticipate business needs and reporting requirements
- Establish and document database architectural guidelines, putting in place operational best practices
- Provide on-call assistance for our R&D Teams
Qualifications
- 8+ years of total experience as a DBA with hands on mission critical DB infrastructures
- 5+ years of experience with UNIX/Linux including basic commands , python and shell scripting
- 5+ years of experience working on AWS PostgreSQL , RDS , Aurora , EC2 , S3 , IAM, ELB , RT53
- AWS Aurora migration experience from EC2 postgres
- Ability to manage, supporting/designing large (at least 100GB+sized) high-availability database systems
- 5+ years of experience in analyzing applications to determine most appropriate migration -strategies
- Expertise with Postgres systems metrics and systems optimization strategies
- 2+ years of experience with NoSQL implementation (DynamoDB)
- 2+ years of data warehousing experience (Redshift or Snowflake)
- Experience with schema design and data normalization
- Understanding of common replication strategies
- SQL query writing and optimization skills
- Monitoring and reporting on performance metrics
- Strong troubleshooting, communication and documentation skills
Keywords: Unix, Linux, Shell scripting, Debugging, Javascript, Application development, Troubleshooting, Senior Advisor, SQL, Python

Job Description:
The Database Administrator (DBA) will be responsible for the configuration, optimization, and maintenance of databases, database connections and reporting views. This includes monitoring performance of critical SQL relational database systems to ensure the availability and consistent performance of corporate applications. This is a hands on position requiring solid technical skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and communications skills.
Key areas of responsibility
Manage SQL Server databases through multiple production lifecycle environments, from development to mission critical production systems

Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes

Preform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities after hours
Technical Knowledge and Skills
Experience with MS SQL Server Administration
Experience with Microsoft T-SQL using SSMS and MS Stack
Programming languages .NET, C#, Python, R-script, Oracle SQL preferred
Experience with Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO), using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools
Experience with backups, restores and recovery models
Knowledge of High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for SQL Server
Keywords: Performance tuning, MS SQL, Data modeling, Disaster recovery, TIBCO, Business intelligence, microsoft, Troubleshooting, Monitoring, Python

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly experienced and skilled Database Manager with a proven track of managing complex database cloud environments. The ideal candidate will have extensive expertise spanning over 10 to 15 years in MS SQL, added advantage of having either Oracle, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB
Job Responsibilities:
10+ years of experience in an Engineering/Architecture and operations capacity supporting a global enterprise Cloud/DC Infrastructure.
Strong hands-on experience in at least any of the two database platforms like Microsoft SQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB.
Demonstrate a solid understanding of cloud applications, and cloud technologies (in IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS).
Actively involved in System Performance by tuning SQL queries and stored procedures by using SQL Profiler, Database Engine Tuning Advisor, Windows performance monitor, DMVs, Resource Governor, Data Collection Reports, crystal reports, DBCC and Custom Script, Built-in performance Report and Activity Monitor.
The primary responsibility of the DBA manager is to provide guidance and leadership and manage a team of DBAs, responsible for production data and database systems in a 24x7 environment. In this role, the DBA Manager will ensure that production data is available in a high-performance, high-availability mode across multiple cloud data centers.
The DBA manager is responsible for continuous planning and managing data management systems to determine the most effective ways to create and structure data storage systems. The DBA Manager will bring to the role experience with SQL and NoSQL database management systems to create and enact a data infrastructure system that s robust, secure, and scales to meet the needs of the growing organization.
On a daily basis, the DBA manager leads and oversees a team of data administrators, and specialists to support the organization s data storage and access needs. The DBA manager identifies production system management tasks from daily operations to monitoring to upgrades and sets priorities, ensuring that team members provide the required level of operational support and adhere to best practices. The DB manager will work with administrators to handle production incidents, and escalations related to user accessor Data Management issues.
The DBA Manager is responsible for planning and implementing production system database reporting and documentation related to database activities.
The DBA Manager is responsible for ensuring audit and regulatory compliance reporting and documentation.
The DBA Manager is expected to lead the team in resolving database issues when they arise within committed SLAs to customers.
Experience in advanced monitoring techniques and automation scripts.
Expertise in designing HA, DR, Backup, and retention architectures.
Understanding of cloud and on-premises storage solutions and how database platforms perform on these solutions.
Required Qualifications for This Role
Education:
The candidate must have at a minimum a bachelor s degree in technology related programs such as information technology, computer science, or engineering.
An advanced degree in IT, data management or specialized training in database administration is a strong plus.
Experience:
A candidate for this position must have at least 10-15 years of work experience in the Cloud Database Administration field and at least 3-4 years as a manager.
Availability of 24x7 production environments managing 10+ database administrators.
Strong hands-on experience in at least any of the two database platforms like Microsoft SQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB.
Soft skills:
The candidate must possess very strong verbal, and written communication skills as well as presentation skills.
The candidate must be capable of effective communication with both database administrators as well as with technical management and business leadership.
Ability to present weekly/Monthly Quality governance and negotiate operational requirements with project stakeholders.
Ability to seamlessly converse with Project stakeholders/Customers on the service offerings.
Stakeholder/Escalation Management:
Ability to lead 24/7 operations and handle any stakeholder escalation meetings for critical/major incidents, and challenges.
Managing internal and external stakeholder expectations in demanding and tough situations.
Keywords: Automation, MS SQL, Postgresql, Billing, Windows, Stored procedures, Business intelligence, Information technology, Monitoring, Auditing

Job Description:
The SQL DBA will provide full lifecycle production assistance to development, infrastructure, testing and ultimately production. The SQL DBA will be managing and maintaining the SQL Server database environments across IaaS and PaaS platforms, ensure development and testing database environments are kept up to date, work on performance tuning and enhancements, troubleshooting, maintenance, health checks and investigations of production system problems, carrying out peer review and enforcing coding standards whilst being conversant in the automation approach associated in a DevOps environment.
The SQL DBA will also be required to provide support and assistance to the wider Data Services team across alternate database technologies to support the day to day operation through BAU activities, ensuring data integrity is maintained and the best possible service available to support business processes, including the provision of out of hours on call.

Key Accountabilities and Main Responsibilities
Accountable:
For the operational support and continuous improvement of the SQL estate, processes for Development and Test environments (System, Load, Performance, UAT) up to, and including Production;
Automation, process efficiency and appropriate tooling (Code/Branch Management and Deployment/Configurations) is utilised to reduce cycle times, and improve reliability, audit and traceability for all system deployments across multiple applications;
Process, best practice and database build standards are consistently applied and constantly improved upon;
Database health checks, backups and implementation of DBA best practise.
Responsible:
Development and merging process/methodology is correctly defined and applied to software and systems to minimise risk in Production environments caused by poor code management techniques/skills;
Provide strong governance for the management, and access, of live data in environments where required (Client Data Take Up) and to ensure obfuscation technologies/practice is embedded;
Ensuring that, working with DevOps, the Development Team has the right environment to maximise their efficacy and obstacles are removed and automation introduced where appropriate;
Production environments are protected by governance, good practice/process, design and fit for purpose environments, to the left of Pre-Prod, supporting all project and change activity;
Ensuring project and change release(s) are packaged to the right quality, repeatable between environments without change or modification and deployed to the target environments - ultimately to Production without detriment or issue in agreed timescales;
Weak points in Process, Technology and Service is addressed through a culture of continual improvement;
Software and processes are correctly documented to ensure single points of knowledge do not become a problem and skills are distributed across the team and department;
Ensuring that software Deliverables/Artefacts, as part of any Change/Project, are progressed providing appropriate status reporting and updates as requested by the Line/Project/Change Manager;

Experience & Personal Attributes
Demonstrable knowledge of database administration (design, installation & troubleshooting) of current MS SQL Server and Windows Server Enterprise platforms
Comprehensive knowledge and experience of Current Microsoft SQL Server versions, IaaS and PaaS
Proven knowledge and experience of Database Mirroring, Log Shipping, Clustering, Availability Groups, Transactional Replication, ETL
Desirable
Database performance and optimisation experience
Experience working with automation deployment tools.
Ability to develop and implement data security guidelines while making data available to those authorised to have access
Ability to ensure the technical integrity of corporate databases by protecting against the loss or misuse of information and designing backup/recovery strategies
Ability to database design, implementation and performance tune
Experience in automated testing of all database releases
Experience in support for all database releases.
Experience of supporting large scale critical production databases.
Competencies
Innovation, change and continuous improvement
Communication
Results focused
Technical awareness
Commercial awareness
Desirable
Leadership and performance
Customer service
Team working
Risk and conduct management
Keywords: Performance tuning, Log shipping, Automation, MS SQL, Coding, Database design, Windows, Customer service, Troubleshooting, Auditing

Job Description:
As a MySQL Database Administrator (DBA), you will be responsible for maintaining, optimizing, and ensuring the availability and performance of our MySQL database systems
Your role will involve implementing best practices, monitoring database performance, performing backups, and troubleshooting issues
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to support application development and ensure data integrity and security
Responsibilities:
Database Management:Install, configure, and upgrade MySQL database software and related tools
Monitor database performance, availability, and resource utilization to ensure optimal performance
Perform regular database maintenance tasks, such as backups, recovery, and schema changes
Performance Optimization:Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks and database-related issues
Optimize queries, indexes, and database configuration settings for improved performance
Implement caching mechanisms and other performance-enhancing techniques
Security and Compliance:Implement and maintain database security measures, including access controls and encryption
Ensure compliance with data protection and privacy regulations
Monitor and audit database activity to detect and address security vulnerabilities
High Availability and Disaster Recovery:Configure and manage database replication, clustering, and failover mechanisms for high availability
Develop and maintain disaster recovery plans and conduct regular testing
Backup and Recovery:Design and implement backup and recovery strategies to safeguard data against loss
Perform regular backup operations and test restoration procedures
Troubleshooting and Problem Resolution:Investigate and troubleshoot database-related issues, such as performance slowdowns, errors, and crashes
Collaborate with development and infrastructure teams to identify root causes and implement solutions
Automation and Scripting:Develop and maintain scripts for database monitoring, maintenance, and automation
Implement tools and processes to streamline repetitive tasks
Documentation and Reporting:Maintain documentation for database configurations, procedures, and best practices
Provide regular status reports on database performance and health
Collaboration and Communication:Work closely with development teams to support application deployment and ensure database compatibility
Collaborate with system administrators and network engineers to optimize overall system performance
Keywords: Automation, HP data protector, database security, MySQL, Disaster recovery, Schema, Database, Application development, data integrity, Auditing

Job Title: Morningstar is hiring For Senior Database Administrator
Job Description:
The Group: At Morningstar, we strive to Empower Investor Success. We tirelessly pursue new ways to combine our data and research with design and technology to help solve investors needs. Our solutions pave the way for investors to achieve their goals with confidence.

The Morningstar International Wealth Platform allows investors and advisers to collaborate through their financial journey with seamless and enjoyable digital experiences. By learning through data and engagement, we build products and offer services that connect people to the financial information and tools they need. Our mission is to enhance the education, engagement, and experience for the investor.

The Role: We are looking for a talented Database administrator to work within one of our Product teams, partnering with team members from Product, Design and Engineering. You will have a strong collaborative background, focusing on working with multidisciplinary teams, to create, shape and form the best possible data products. You should be comfortable and skilled with challenging the status quo and relish the idea of solving hard problems through deep collaboration with Customers and cross functional teams.
You will tackle interesting, novel situations every day and youll have the opportunity to partner with multiple product teams at Morningstar in order to deliver exceptional service to the Wealth Platform business.

The SQL Server DBA will be responsible for the implementation, configuration, maintenance, and performance of critical SQL Server RDBMS systems, to ensure the availability and consistent performance of our corporate applications. This is a hands-onÃÂ position requiring solid technical skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills. The successful candidate will be responsible for the development and sustainment of the SQL Server Warehouse, ensuring its operational readiness (security, health and performance), executing data loads, and performing data modelling in support of multiple development teams. The data warehouse supports an enterprise application suite of program management tools. Must be capable of working independently and collaboratively.

Responsibilities
Create and manage multiple databases and capacity planning
Monitor, maintain database system and troubleshoot problems that may arise
Maintain data integrity and security (manage roles, permission of database users).
Use tools like SQL profiler for database tuning, should be able to generate traces, execution plans, identify performance bottleneck, deadlocks/contention and resolve them.
Develop strategies and implement solutions for managing back-ups, restoration and replication.
Create and manage constraints and indexes.
Support software developers with database operations including the development of complex SQL, tuning of DML and the creation of stored procedures.
Proactive housekeeping/archiving and shrinking of databases.
Manage production, QA, Stage and development database environments.
Create detailed documentation including diagrams of database infrastructure.
Learn relevant business processes and understand the data flow, criticality and dependencies.
Effectively coordinate and communicate with all the stakeholders (internal teams and clients).


Requirements
Bachelors or MasterÃÂs degree in computer science or equivalent and a total of 4-8+ yearsÃÂ experience in MSSQL Database administration using SQL Server 2012/2014/2016/2017/2019 versions.
Experience in SQL Server Clustering and HA technologies including mirroring, log shipping, failover cluster, AlwaysOn and various replication technologies would be an advantage.
Sound knowledge of RDBMS concepts, database architecture and SQL/T-SQL.
Proficient with SQL server profiler for monitoring and troubleshooting database activity and performance.
Ability to develop procedure documents and maintain detailed database related documents.
Innovative approach to work, constantly looking for upgrading the system to more efficient and effective new technologies.
Able to organize work efficiently and work well under stress, changing priorities, and time constraints.
Manage SQL Server databases through multiple product lifecycle environments, from development to mission-critical production systems.
Configure and maintain database servers and processes, including monitoring of system health and performance, to ensure high levels of performance, availability, and security.
Apply data modelling techniques to ensure development and implementation support efforts meet integration and performance expectations Independently analyze, solve, and correct issues in real-time, providing problem resolution end-to-end.
Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes Assist developers with complex query tuning and schema refinement.
Provide 24x7 support for critical production systems. Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities after hours.
Share domain and technical expertise, providing technical mentorship and cross-training to other peers and team members.

Interested candidates can share their profiles on Neha.shaikh@morningstar.com

Job Description:
MS SQL DBA is required to support our Production SQL server DB and Core instances in support model.
The SQL server DBA will be responsible for performance tuning, administrating, monitoring, troubleshooting performance issues, recovering the database from any critical state of the SQL server databases .
Would be responsible for reviewing application/databases, identify performance bottlenecks and fixing those. Also MSSQL DBA would be tied up with CCC team [ SAAS clients] in co-ordination with the PACS-Support team to provide support across the cloud & on-premises clients.
Understand the ticket logged details. Validate the completeness of information provided and if required, collect further information from client. Use the collected information to analyze the problem
Provide Production support on any critical DB issues, DB backup, Restore and Disaster recovery
Evaluate and analyze custom SQL server programs/T-SQLs for high performance issues
Creating SQL objects like Tables, Views, Indexes, Stored Procedures, Triggers, Rules, Defaults and user defined functions
Hands on experience in advance SQL server concepts (Performance Tuning, Larger subqueries, JOINS, PerfMon tooling)
Analyze, tune & test identified top 30 programs, integrations and reports based on current CPU, I/O & throughput utilization and implement best practices recommended by SQL server for improved performance
Proficient in tuning T-SQL queries using SQL server profiler, Execution Plan, Performance Monitor, DBCC Commands, Database Tuning Advisor, Index Fragmentation techniques to improve the database performance and ensure high availability
Participation in document improvement in the SQL level metrics CPU, I/O requests, throughput, Files and File-groups to a desirable level
Report trace files comparison for the required parameters before and after the optimization for the improvement of statistics
Analyzing trace files, Identify problem queries, I/O, Waits, Correlated sub queries and Parameters validation
Tune the queries and use Materialized or temp tables if required, Re-write the logic for better performance if required
Replace Correlated sub queries, reducing Loop Overhead for DML Statements and Queries
Writing Computation-Intensive Programs in T-SQL & Monitoring SQL Performance and IO
SKILLS
BE/ BTec/ MCA graduate with 4 to 6 years relevant SQL server DBA experience
Experience in database backup & restore activities and HA configuration
Should be able to deliver 24 X 7 support to our global customer base
Working experience in Microsoft SQL server tools like SSMS and BI tools
T-SQL Development & Azure SQL Development knowledge
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Job Description:
Skills : SQL DBA
  Experience - 4+ yrs. of relevant exp.
The SQL Database Administrator Perform database engineering and administration activities including design, planning, configuration, monitoring, automation, self- serviceability, alerting, and space management, database backup and recovery
Plan computerized databases, including base definition, structure, documentation, long- range requirements, operational guidelines, and protection
Key Responsibilities List
Formulate and monitor policies, procedures and standards relating to database management.
Provide design standards and guidance for projects and technical roadmaps.
Capacity Planning:
Forecast future database growth based on usage trends and plan for hardware and storage requirements accordingly to ensure scalability and optimal performance.
Patch Management and Upgrades:
Plan and execute SQL Server software upgrades, patches, and service packs.
Stay up to date with the latest SQL Server releases and features.
Troubleshooting and Issue Resolution:
Investigate and resolve complex database-related issues, including data corruption, performance problems, and connectivity challenges.
Automation and Scripting:
Develop automation scripts and tools to streamline repetitive tasks, improve efficiency, and reduce the risk of human errors.
Monitoring and Alerting:
Set up monitoring and alerting systems to proactively identify and address potential database issues before they become critical.
Compliance and Best Practices:
Ensure that databases comply with industry standards and internal policies.
Follow best practices for database management, security, and performance optimization.
Mentoring and Training:
Provide guidance and support to Level 1 and Level 2 DBAs, sharing knowledge and expertise to foster their professional growth.
Performance Analysis and Reporting:
Generate performance reports and analysis for stakeholders and management to provide insights into the database environments health and performance.
Documentation:
Maintain up-to-date documentation of database configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps.
Vendor and Third-Party Tool Management: Evaluate and manage third-party tools and solutions that assist in database management, monitoring, and performance tuning. Resolve locking conflicts/blocking and resource utilization.
Build tools for customers and internal teams by creating scripts or using software to automate administration tasks and DBA processes.
Consult with customers on SQL Server including best practices and SQL Server Disaster Recovery setups.
Participate in sales implementations vendor calls to provide advanced knowledge in the purchase of software, hardware or services that can be used to improve the performance of the database server.
Carry out disaster recovery planning and execution including, log shipping, mirroring, replication, and AlwaysOn.
Works with the product organization to assist in the roll out of new products.
Participate in 24X7 production support for SQL Server infrastructure.
Executes large sized, complex database projects.
Ensures projects are properly documented.
Knowledge List
Proficient Skills in SQL Server Architecture, Installation and Configuration, Performance Tuning, High Availability and Disaster Recovery (HADR), Monitoring and Troubleshooting
Database Migrations and Upgrades:
Experience in planning and executing database migrations and upgrades, including version compatibility, testing, and minimizing downtime.
SQL Server in the Cloud:
Knowledge of deploying and managing SQL Server in cloud platforms such as Azure SQL Database and Amazon RDS.
SQL Server Best Practices:
Familiarity with industry best practices for SQL Server administration, including configuration settings, maintenance tasks, and disaster recovery strategies.
Ability to communicate technical info and ideas so others will understand.
Ability to apply varying leadership skills and traits that create solutions and results to unexpected situations.

Experience working with Postgresql /MySQL/AWS RDS
Database Specialty Certifications in AWS id preferred.

Job Description:
About Aakash BYJU'S Technology Innovation Lab

Are you passionate about transforming the field of education as we know it?

The way education is imparted has been disrupted massively due to forces such as Ed-tech digital revolution, the advancement in artificial intelligence technology and the pandemic. Given the rapid pace of transformation, the vision of the Technology Innovation Lab at Aakash BYJUs is to make the education of the future a reality. The Technology Innovation Lab aims to leverage state-of-the-art technologies to develop industry-defining bleeding-edge solutions for a student-first world-class hybrid learning experience. This involves -

Reimagining and conceptualizing how education will be imparted in the future in the omni-channel and immersive learning environment
Building data platforms such as Power BI dashboards to facilitate students, parents, teachers and the business
Creating applications to support the futuristic tech-enabled smart classrooms
Conceptualizing and developing mobile and web applications for seamless customer experience
Developing Internet of Things (IoT) driven integrations into applications to build futuristic learning experience
Leveraging Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) to identity interventions to boost student performance

If this excites you, we might have the perfect opportunity for you in the worlds most valued Ed-tech company!

Purpose of the Role

Develop software solutions that enable the students, parents and teachers to have superior learning and teaching experiences, both inside and outside the classroom.

Key Responsibilities

Hands on Experience in MS SQL Server, PL/ SQL And MYSQL as a primary Skill set.
Exposure to AWS database is required
Contribute in all the phases of the software development lifecycle
Craft a well-designed, testable, efficient code
Effectively and seamlessly manage communication with all stakeholders.
Manage and provide live support to the developed applications

Experience

8+ years of hands-on experience in Data base administration
AWS experience

What We Offer

As a technology professional in Aakash BYJUs Technology Innovation Lab we offer you an opportunity to -

Become a pioneer of the education of the future by reimagining and building innovative solutions for the Ed-tech industry leading hybrid learning experience
Be a force of technological disruption as a part of a passionate and high growth team on an exciting endeavor to transform the education industry
Innovate and challenge the status quo with the backing of BYJUs, the largest Ed-tech company in the world
Belong to an upbeat, flexible and relaxed work culture with a specific focus on collaboration
Craft an excellent career at Aakash BYJUs through a broad realm of career tracks and opportunities
Excel in your chosen stream and become a renowned technologist in the Ed-tech industry with heavy investment from the business into your learning, exposure and growth
Have a highly competitive compensation and benefits package

Job Description

Accountable For:
Responsible for providing support for operational database services to the organization.

Reviews service related reports (database backups, maintenance, monitoring) on a daily basis to ensure service related issues are identified and resolved within established SLAs

REQUIREMENTS:
A minimum of 4 to 5 years of experience in database administration and support in Oracle versions 12c through 19c.
Expertise needed setting up, monitoring and troubleshooting Oracle Golden Gate.
Experience in troubleshooting and resolving database integrity issues, performance issues, blocking and deadlocking issues, replication issues, log shipping issues, connectivity issues, security issues etc.

Documentation skills for processes and procedures (creating Knowledge Transfer documents, run-books, topology etc.)
Ability to work in a team-oriented environment that is fast-paced and demanding.

Ability to handle multiple demands with a sense of urgency, drive and energy and with the ability to deliver on time.

Job Description:
Role: Teradata Performance DBA 

Job Location: Mumbai/ Pune/ Bangalore/ Hyderabad/ Virtual

Key Responsibilities
Manage Production/Development databases performance in the following areas
Review Teradata system reports and provide performance assessment report with recommendations to optimize system.
Investigate and quantify opportunities from performance assessment reports and
Apply best practices in each of the areas.
Monitor using Viewpoint tool for Teradata system performance using different portlets.
Review poor performing queries generated from BI/ETL tools and provide best practice recommendations on how to simply and restructure views, apply PPI or other index changes
Closely monitor the performance of various work groups on the system and make sure data is available to business as per the SLA requirement.   
Statistics Management and Optimization
Optimal index analysis - Review Index usage on tables and recommend adding dropping indexes for optimal data access
Review uncompressed tables, analyze its usage and implement compression to save space and reduce IO activity using various algorithms like MVC/ BLC/ ALC.
Optimize locking statements in views, macros & queries to eliminate blocking contention invest
Review the Spool Limits for the users and recommend optimal limit for the Ad-hoc users to avoid run away queries over consuming system resources.
Check for Mismatch data types in the system and make them unique to avoid costly translations during query processing
Review Set tables and check for the options to convert to MultiSet to avoid costly duplicate row checking operation
Review Large Scan Tables on the system and analyze for using PPI, MLPPI, Compression, Secondary indexes & Join Indexes
Fine tune various application parameters/number of sessions to ensure optimal functioning of the application.
Analyze various applications and understand the space requirements and segregate the disk space under the categories of perm, spool and temp space
Setting up the database hierarchy that includes database creation and management of objects such as users, Roles, Profiles, tables, views
Maintain profiles, roles, access rights and permissions for Teradata user groups and objects.
Well conversant with various ticketing system/production change request/ Teradata Incident management.
Exposure to troubleshoot the FastLoad / Multiload/ FastExport/ BTEQ/ TPump errors, should be good at error handling.
Exposure to DWH Env (Knowledge of ETL/DI/BI Reporting).
Generate periodic performance reports using PDCR and identify bottlenecks with the system performance
Establish PDCR canary performance baselines. Utilize standard canary queries to identify variance from baseline.
Effective usage of TASM & Priority distribution to penalize the resource intensive queries, Give high priority to business critical workloads, Throttling of different workloads for optimal throughput and provide performance reports to check workload management health.

Basic Qualifications
3-12 years of Teradata DBA experience.
Should have worked in Unix platforms.
Excellent oral and written communication skills in the English language.
Must be willing to provide 24x7 on-call support on a rotational basis with the team.
Must be willing to travel both short-term and long-term

Desirable Skills:-
Understanding of Normalization and De-normalization concept
Ability to write efficient SQL & exposure to query tuning.
Exposure to visualization tools like Tableau, PowerBI.
Should have good working knowledge on UNIX shell, Python scripting.
Should be good at automating various processes.

Please share your profile at neha.jaiswal@teradata.com with below details:

Job Description:
Perform database engineering and administration activities including design, planning, configuration, monitoring, automation, self- serviceability, alerting, and space management, database backup and recovery
Plan computerized databases, including base definition, structure, documentation, long- range requirements, operational guidelines and protection
Key Responsibilities List
Formulate and monitor policies, procedures and standards relating to database management.
Provide design standards and guidance for projects and technical roadmaps.
Capacity Planning: Forecast future database growth based on usage trends and plan for hardware and storage requirements accordingly to ensure scalability and optimal performance.
Patch Management and Upgrades: Plan and execute SQL Server software upgrades, patches, and service packs. Stay up-to-date with the latest SQL Server releases and features.
Troubleshooting and Issue Resolution: Investigate and resolve complex database-related issues, including data corruption, performance problems, and connectivity challenges.
Automation and Scripting: Developautomation scripts and tools to streamline repetitive tasks, improve efficiency, and reduce the risk of human errors.
Monitoring and Alerting: Set up monitoring and alerting systems to proactively identify and address potential database ssues before they become critical.
Compliance and Best Practices: Ensure that databases comply with industry standards and internal policies.
Follow best practices for database management, security, and performance optimization.
Mentoring and Training: Provide guidance and support to Level 1 and Level 2 DBAs, sharing knowledge and expertise to foster their professional growth.
Performance Analysis and Reporting: Generate performance reports and analysis for stakeholders and management to provide insights into the database environments health and performance.
Documentation: Maintain up-to-date documentation of database configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps.
Vendor and Third-Party Tool Management: Evaluate and manage third-party tools and solutions that assist in database management, monitoring, and performance tuning. Resolve locking conflicts/blocking and resource utilization. Build tools for customers and internal teams by creating scripts or using software to automate administration tasks and DBA processes.
Consult with customers on SQL Server including best practices and SQL Server Disaster Recovery setups.
Participate in sales implementations vendor calls to provide advanced knowledge in the purchase of software, hardware or services that can be used to improve the performance of the database server. Carry out disaster recovery planning and execution including, log shipping, mirroring, replication, and AlwaysOn.
Works with the product organization to assist in the roll out of new products.
Participate in 24X7 production support for SQL Server infrastructure
Executes large sized, complex database projects. Ensures projects are properly documented.
Knowledge List
Proficient Skills in SQL Server Architecture, Installation and Configuration, Performance Tuning, High Availability and Disaster Recovery (HADR), Monitoring and Troubleshooting
Database Migrations and Upgrades:Experience in planning and executing database migrations and upgrades,including version compatibility, testing, and minimizing downtime.
SQL Server in the Cloud: Knowledge of deploying and managing SQL Server in cloud platforms such as Azure SQL Database and Amazon RDS.
SQL Server Best Practices: Familiarity with industry best practices for SQL Server administration, including configuration settings, maintenance tasks, and disaster recovery strategies.
Ability to communicate technical info and ideas so others will understand.
Ability to apply varying leadership skills and traits that create solutions and results to unexpected situations.
Keywords: Patch management, Performance tuning, Log shipping, Automation, Production support, SQL Database Administrator, Disaster recovery, Troubleshooting, Operations, Capacity planning

2 years of hands-on experience operating MS SQL servers and related technologies in Azure.
Very good understanding of database encryption, high-availability, disaster recovery, database replication, backup/restore.

Job Description:
Our Enterprise Data & Shared Services team is looking for a highly capable Senior Database Administrator that can operate effectively without day-to-day supervision. You will be creating and implementing standardized database management procedures, and overseeing the installation, security, and upgrading of our database.

You will be working with a global team of professionals to design and develop database systems and to provide guidance to customers on database structures and features. You will create standard procedures to enhance scalability and performance of existing database architecture. You will need to be able to troubleshoot complex database issues in accurate and timely manner. You will need to develop and maintain database disaster recovery procedures to ensure continuous availability and speedy recovery.

You will also need to stay up to date with new database technologies and analyze such technologies to bring into scope of existing infrastructure.

Your Role Accountabilities:
Providing customer support to other business and technology teams for issues that involve a database system.
Working effectively with a team that is globally dispersed.
Deploying, upgrading, relocating, and decommissioning database servers both on-prem and in the cloud.
Designing, implementing, and testing high availability and business continuity plans for our Tier 1 applications.
Creating, reviewing and maintaining database documentation.
Creating, reviewing and maintaining operational documentation that can be used by our 24/7 operations team and junior database administrators.
Reviewing the existing database monitoring and backup strategy and come up with a new strategy based on the business requirements.
Being part of the team that includes participation in an On-Call rotation to provide our customers 24/7 support.

Qualifications & Experiences:
ÃÂ Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, information systems, or information technology.
ÃÂ 7+ years of experience in database management.
ÃÂ Very good experience in database administration in all aspects of the SQL Server platform including clustering, availability group, replication, SSIS, and SSRS.
ÃÂ Experience with other technologies like Oracle, SAP Hana, db2, mysql, Potgresql, snowflake, and databricks will be considered a plus.
ÃÂ Experience working on databases that are hosted on-prem as well as the AWS or Azure cloud (PASS and SASS implementations).
ÃÂ Experience automating, scripting, and streamlining processes for efficiency and accuracy utilizing Powershell scripting and Windows BAT.
ÃÂ Ability and experience with the development of processes and procedures to standardize Database installations and configuration.
ÃÂ Extensive experience with implementation and maintenance of Disaster Recovery and High availability.
ÃÂ Ability to work on unusually complex technical problems and provide solutions that are highly innovative and ingenious.
ÃÂ Ability to provide technical documentation and project plans for technical staff members.
ÃÂ Excellent communication, presentation, and customer relationship skills.

Job Description:
The Senior DBA position will be responsible for maintaining the company s database systems (currently S4 HANA, PostgreSQL, Snowflake, etc DB) including back-up, performance tuning, capacity planning, monitoring critical events and DB documentation
Key Areas of Responsibility :
1. Create and manage multiple databases and assist in capacity planning.
2. Monitor, maintain database systems and troubleshoot problems that may arise.
3. Maintain data integrity and security (manage roles and permissions of database users).
4. Use tools like Profiler for database tuning. Generate traces, execution plans, identify performance issues, deadlocks/contention and resolve them.
5. Develop strategies and implement solutions for managing back-ups, restoration and replication.
6. Create and manage constraints and indexes.
7. Support software developers with database operations including the development of complex SQL, tuning of DML and the creation of stored procedures.
8. Proactive housekeeping/archiving and shrinking of databases.
9. Manage production, QA and development database environments.
10. Create detailed documentation including diagrams of database infrastructure.
11. Learn relevant business processes and understand the data flow, criticality and dependencies.
12. Effectively coordinate and communicate with all the stakeholders (internal teams).
Requirements / Qualifications :
1. Bachelors or Masters degree in computer science or equivalent education and experience.
2. 3-5 years experience in administering S4 HANA, PostgreSQL and other DB.
3. Extensive experience writing T-SQL and stored procedures and query tuning on high transaction systems.
4. Sound knowledge of RDBMS concepts, database architecture and SQL/T-SQL.
5. Proficient with profiler for monitoring and troubleshooting database activity and performance.
6. Experience in Clustering, log shipping, failover cluster and various replication technologies would be an advantage.
7. Knowledge of other databases like MySQL, Snowflake, MongoDB, No SQL will be an advantage.
8. Ability to develop procedure documents and maintain detailed database related documents.
9. Innovative approach to work, constantly looking for upgrading the system to more efficient and effective new technologies
Keywords: T-SQL, Database architecture, Performance tuning, Log shipping, Compliance management, MySQL, Database, Stored procedures, Database Administrator, SQL
