Job Description:
The Hybrid Cloud SQL Database Administrator (DBA) is responsible for managing and maintaining both on-premises and cloud databases, ensuring their performance, security, and availability
The primary focus of this role is on MS SQL Server and cloud-based databases, with secondary expertise in Oracle databases
The DBA collaborates with cross-functional teams, including product engineers, software developers, and application mangers, to ensure efficient database operations
The ideal candidate for this role will have IT infrastructure experience in both Cloud and On-premises database administration.
Note : Because the role is part of a global team, the candidate must be able to work in shift model.
  Task and Responsibilities:
Database Support: Provide support and administration for MS SQL Server databases and Cloud databases. Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues and incidents, including performance problems, connectivity errors, and data inconsistencies.
Database Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance by analyzing query execution plans, index usage, database statistics, and other performance indicators. Identify and resolve bottlenecks and performance issues to ensure optimal database response times.
Database Security: Implement and enforce security measures to protect the organizations databases from unauthorized access, data breaches, and data loss. Configure user access permissions, roles, and privileges based on the principle of least privilege.
Database Backup and Recovery: Develop and maintain backup and recovery strategies to ensure the integrity and availability of the organizations data. Perform regular backups, test restore procedures, and implement disaster recovery plans to minimize data loss and downtime.
Database Monitoring and Maintenance: Monitor database health, availability, and capacity to proactively identify and resolve potential issues. Perform routine maintenance tasks such as database reorganization, index rebuilding, and database statistics updates.
Database Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for database configurations, schemas, procedures, and processes. Document database changes and update data dictionaries to ensure accuracy and clarity of database-related information.
Database Upgrades and Patching: Plan and execute database software upgrades and apply patches to ensure database systems are up to date with the latest security fixes and performance enhancements.
Coordinate with system administrators and vendors for a smooth upgrade process.
Qualifications:
Overall 5+ years experience as Database Administrator.
Bachelors or masters degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.
Experience with Azure cloud.
Relevant industry certifications, such as Microsoft Certified Database Administrator, etc. is a plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Technical Skills
Strong expertise in MS SQL Server database administration, including performance tuning, security, and backup and recovery.
Proficiency in cloud-based database technologies, such as Microsoft Azure SQL Database, Microsoft Azure SQL Managed Instance and CosmosDB, including deployment, configuration, and performance optimization.
Familiarity with Oracle database administration, including installation, configuration, performance tuning, and backup and recovery is a plus.
Solid understanding of database concepts, SQL, and query optimization techniques.
Knowledge of database security principles and best practices.
Experience with database monitoring tools and performance analysis.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex database issues.
Excellent documentation and communication skills.
Keywords: Performance tuning, MS SQL, query optimization, database security, Disaster recovery, Database, Information technology, SQL

Your Job

Our Team

Job Description:
Role & responsibilities

Database Management: Administer and maintain cloud-based databases,
including setup, configuration, monitoring, and optimization of database
instances.
- Performance Optimization: Analyze database performance and proactively
identify and resolve issues to ensure optimal performance and
responsiveness for end-users.
- Security Management: Implement and enforce database security
measures, including access controls, encryption, and data masking, to
protect sensitive information and comply with industry standards and
regulations.
- Backup and Recovery: Develop and manage database backup and recovery
strategies to ensure data continuity and disaster recovery preparedness.
- Capacity Planning: Monitor database growth and proactively plan for
scaling and resource allocation to accommodate increasing data demands.

1

- Troubleshooting and Issue Resolution: Identify and resolve
database-related problems, including investigating and resolving data
inconsistencies and performance bottlenecks.

teams, and other stakeholders to provide database-related support and
guidance throughout the software development lifecycle.

configurations, processes, and procedures to ensure a knowledge base for
the team.

Job Description:
Job Title: Manager Database Administrator
Industry Type: Software Product
Job Location: Hyderabad
Department: Engineering - Software & QA
Experience: 10+ years
Key Skills (Must Have): MySQL, NoSQL, DB Migrations Preferred Skills: Mongo DB & AWS Cloud JOB DESCRIPTION Position Overview: We are seeking a highly experienced and skilled Senior Database Administrator (DBA) with a proven track recording managing complex database environments. The ideal candidate will have extensive expertise spanning over 10 to15 years in Oracle, MySQL, Elastic search. Added advantage to have Mongo DB and AWS cloud technologies. As a Senior DBA, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the reliability, performance, and scalability of our organization's databases while actively contributing to architectural decisions and strategic planning related to DB changes.
Responsibilities: Database Management:
Design, deploy, and maintain robust and scalable database systems across various platforms, including Oracle, MySQL & NoSQL,
Perform routine database maintenance, including backups, restores, upgrades, and patching, to ensure data integrity and system availability.
Monitor database performance, identify bottlenecks, and optimize queries for optimal performance and responsiveness. **Troubleshooting and Problem Resolution:
Diagnose and resolve complex database-related issues promptly, ensuring minimal impact on production systems.
Investigate performance problems, analyze root causes, and implement corrective actions. **Security and Compliance:
Establish and enforce database security measures, including access controls, encryption, and data masking, to protect sensitive information.
Ensure compliance with industry regulations and standards pertaining to data privacy and security. **Automation and Scripting:
Develop automation scripts and tools to streamline database provisioning, configuration, and monitoring processes.
Implement and maintain database-as-code practices, promoting infrastructure as code principles. **Collaboration and Mentoring:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, provide database expertise, and contribute to architectural decisions.
Mentor and guide junior DBAs, sharing your wealth of knowledge and fostering skill development within the team. **Documentation and Reporting:
Maintain thorough documentation of database configurations, processes, and procedures.
Generate regular reports on database performance, growth, and operational metrics. Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
10 to 15 years of progressive experience as a Database Administrator, with a strong focus on MySQL.
Proven expertise in database design, implementation, migration and optimization. ÃÂ Proficiency in database scripting and automation using tools like SQL.
Strong understanding of data security, encryption, and compliance standards.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to analyse and resolve complex technical issues.
Effective communication skills, with the ability to collaborate across teams and mentor junior staff.
Relevant certifications in MySQL or related fields are a plus.
Strong commitment to staying updated with industry trends and emerging technologies.
Join Our Team: If you're a seasoned DBA seeking a challenging role where your expertise will make a significant impact, we invite you to join our dynamic team. You'll have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, collaborate with talented professionals, and contribute to the growth and success of our organization. This is a full time role that needs working from Hyderabad Office from Monday to Friday
Keywords: Database Administration, NoSQL, MySQL, MongoDB

Job Description:
The DBA team ensures the reliability and integrity of data, including the availability and consistency of data throughout the organization. DBAs work with business analysts, system architects, software developers, and quality assurance resources to provide consistent data across all applications in support of business objectives.
Roles & Responsibilities
Data Integrity:
Ensure recoverability of data through the design, implementation, and practice of defined database disaster recovery strategies
Ensure availability of data through the design, implementation, and practice of database high availability strategies
Establish and maintain the quality of data throughout the organization to support business goals
Monitoring and Maintenance:
Monitor database performance to identify database configuration, hardware, and SQL query tuning opportunities
Monitor database resource usage and recommend hardware/software changes as needed
Monitor database utilities to ensure maintenance policies are being achieved
Documentation and Standards:
Provide documentation for database design and modification
Document established DBA-driven processes, workflows, and tasks
Adhere to all applicable team and department standards governing workplace performance
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
Familiarity with relational database management systems (DB2, PostgreSQL) and their core concepts
Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL)
Experience with Unix and Microsoft Windows environments
Ability to prioritize tasks and work independently
Ability to collaborate in team environment
Desired Qualifications
Strong knowledge of DB2 and PostgreSQL Server relational database management systems and concepts
Scripting experience with sh, ksh, bash, awk, sed, Python, and/or Perl
Familiarity with Ansible and Infrastructure as Code concepts
Additional information
Expeditors offers excellent benefits:
Paid Vacation, Holiday
Health Plan: Medical Insurance
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Training and Education Programs
Unlimited opportunities for career advancement

Job Description:
SUMMARY
Our Software Infrastructure group is looking for a DBA (Technologist) to join our Development and Deployment team. As a part of this team, you will have the opportunity to help shape the future of cloud native technologies at Expeditors.
If you join our team, you will:
Obsess over your customers and deliver a first-class experience for them.
Collaborate with a diverse team of highly passionate and talented technologists.
Drive new ideas, experiment with them, and see them through adoption.
Contribute to Expeditors cloud native communities of practice and share new ideas that help drive adoption.
Take ownership of ambiguous problems and deliver solutions for them.
Learn from others and help grow those in our team to achieve their best.
If you are someone who is interested in experimenting with new ideas, driving them to fruition, working actively across the broader cloud native community, this job is for you!
As a DBA, you shall involve in designing, implementing, and maintaining our database systems, ensuring their efficiency, integrity, and security. DBAs work with system architects, developers, and other resources to provide consistent data across all applications in support of business objectives. DBAs should be familiar with industry best practices and have a proactive approach to identifying and resolving database-related issues.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Ensure recoverability of data through the design, implementation, and practice of defined database disaster recovery strategies.
Ensure availability of data through the design, implementation, and practice of database high availability strategies.
Establish and maintain the quality of data throughout the organization to support business goals.
Monitor database performance to identify database configuration, hardware, and SQL query tuning opportunities.
Ensure database security by implementing access controls, user authentication, and data encryption.
Monitor database resource usage and recommend hardware/software changes as needed.
Monitor database utilities to ensure maintenance policies are being achieved.
Provide documentation for database design and modifications.
Document established DBA-driven processes, workflows, and tasks.
Adhere to all applicable team and department standards governing workplace performance.
Stay updated with the latest database technologies, trends, and best practices.
Active participation in the Expeditors Database Administrator Community of Practice.
QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum Qualifications
8+ years Database administration experience.
Strong knowledge of PostgreSQL and DB2 databases.
Knowledge on Mongo DB and Microsoft SQL Server is added advantage.
Familiarity with relational database management systems and their core concepts.
Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL).
Experience with Red Hat and Microsoft Windows environments.
Scripting experience with bash, sh, and/or Python.
Experience with database clustering technologies (VCS).
Familiarity with backup and recovery strategies, disaster recovery planning, and high availability solutions.
Ability to prioritize tasks and work independently.
Ability to collaborate in a team environment.
Desired Qualifications
Strong knowledge of SQL Server relational database management systems and concepts.
Experience with PostgreSQL, DB2 and Mongo DB.
Ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly.
Able to formulate and implement a design strategy from a mix of business requirements, concept documents, and verbal descriptions.
Proficient working with Ansible.
Experience in conducting or participating in audits.
Familiar with SAFe methodologies.
REPORTING STRUCTURE
Team Manager, Information Services
Keywords: postgresql, db2, mongo db, python, vcs, bash, SAFe, sql

Job Description:
Main Purpose of Job
The core job of Data Engineer - DBA involves:
Use various methods to transform raw data into useful data systems. For example, create algorithms, strive for efficiency by aligning data systems with business goals.
Combine raw data/information from different sources to create consistent and machine-readable formats.
Provide a seamless flow of information throughout the company.
Implement methods to improve data reliability and quality.
Develop and test architectures that enable data extraction and transformation for predictive or prescriptive modeling.

Key Accountabilities
DHW, Data lake, Datamart creation & maintenance.
Defining & managing Dimensions & Facts Tables with standardized usage of Star, Snowflake, Galaxy Schemas.
Replication, Mirroring, ELT/ETL Management.
End to End Environment Management of AWS environments for Alteryx, Tableau etc.
On-time delivery (with pre-agreed quality parameters) of self-service analytics and BI portal under constraints/limitations i.e. Tableau High Availability.
Analyze and organize raw data, developing and maintaining datasets from it.
Explore and implement ways to enhance data quality and reliability.
Build data systems and pipelines.
Prepare data for prescriptive and predictive modelling.
Combine raw information from different sources.
Identify opportunities for data acquisition.
The post holder will carry out any other duties as are within the scope and purpose of the job as requested by the Line Manager and ensure full utilization of all ISS systems according to Standard Operating Procedures.

Key Deliverables
Ingest, store, process and analyze data from different sources through a scalable, secure, and reliable infrastructure with a philosophy of economy of scale.
Designing and implementing databases in accordance to end user information need.
Defining users and enabling data distribution to the right user, in appropriate format and in a timely manner.
Minimise database downtime and manage parameters to provide fast query responses.
Determine, enforce, and document database policies, procedures, and standards.
Perform tests and evaluations regularly to ensure data security, privacy, and integrity.
Monitor database performance, implement changes, and apply new patches and versions when required.
L2 and L3 support and operations.
Dimensionally modelled data warehouses.
Contribute to administrative activities of Analytics & BI Platform for:
Design permission structure of analytics & BI Toolset for initial set up and for ongoing maintenance of it.
User / Identity Management.
Overall platform configuration and administration.

Competency Requirements
Direct
Customer Focus
Ethics & Integrity
Organisational Commitment
Health & Safety Compliance
Key
Analytical Thinking
Data Collection
Data Analysis
Planning and Delivery
Quality Focus
Team Work
Technical Solutions
Inter-cultural competence
Innovative
Management
Business Acumen
Shares the Vision
Connecting Business, Strategy & Geography
Decision Making
Establish Focus
Leadership
Managing Change

Knowledge, Experience & Skills
Essential
Previous experience as a data engineer or in a similar role.
Technical expertise with data warehouse design (e.g. dimensional modelling), data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Programming (XML/Java script/Python/R etc.) and ETL/ELT frameworks and knowledge of learning machine methods.
Hands-on experience with SQL or similar database design, SQL queries, SSRS and SSIS or similar and DBA tools.
Excellent knowledge of data backup, recovery, security, integrity.
In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP), online transactional processing (OLTP).
8+ Years in an IT environment with at least 5+ years of hands on experience as Data Engineer - DBA delivering Analytics and BI projects.
Experience in DataOps, Production Support.
Strong understanding of SDLC/engineering processes, roles, Requirements Management, QA etc. with practical experience of tools supporting it viz. Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, TeamCity etc.
Good understanding of project management methodologies (e.g. Scrum, Kanban, Scaled Agile, SAFe, ITIL etc)
Strong communicator (verbal and written); ability to talk to different disciplines of stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Attention to detail and ability to self-review work to ensure work is error free.

Desirable
Any Shipping or Maritime Certification / experience.
Knowledge of port agency
Presentation and facilitation skills.
Certified in any of the Analytical and BI tools.
Experience of, and assisted in, the implementation of governance, controls, and standards.
Data engineering certification is a plus.

Education and Professional Qualifications
Essential
Bachelors degree in Engineering or Technology in Computer Science, Maths, Statistics, Data Management, or a related field.
Desirable
Good Commercial alignment / awareness.
Shipping Industry
Prince 2 / PMP

Other Requirements
Essential
Passion for Data technology delivering business value.
Ability to travel.
Desirable
Additional language

Location: Pan India
Keywords: Data Engineering, BI Platform, Alteryx, SSRS, Galaxy Schemas, Tableau, SAFe, ELT, database management systems, Tableau High Availability, Java script, L3 support, SQL queries, DHW, R, L2 support, Snowflake, Scrum, AWS, Python, Data lake, SSIS, ITIL, SDLC, DataOps, XML, Data Analysis, Identity Management

Job Description:
The Oracle Database Administrator uses their command of emerging technologies, industry best practices, and system requirements to recommend and document specific elements of database architecture including servers and their components, networking and related appliances, and third party software and programs
The Oracle Database Administrator seeks out and recognizes opportunities for process improvement, re-engineering, and automation, and employs practices intended to improve customer satisfaction and reduce costs
The Oracle Database Administrator is expected to consistently leverage their significant expertise and skillset by routinely providing guidance and mentorship to peers during informal knowledge transfer opportunities and formalized training, and acts as a point of escalation for needs within and outside of conventional business hours
This duty may be scheduled in advance or in an on-call capacity according to the needs of the organization
Qualifications
Minimum of five (5) years of experience in the administration, backup, recovery, and migration of Oracle databases
Experience with Oracle Golden Gate and ODS
Significant experience with the design, analysis, deployment, integration, optimization, performance tuning, troubleshooting, administration, and/or consultation of the following disciplines or technologies is required:
Oracle Real Application Clusters, Recovery Manager, Data Guard, Golden Gate, Application Express, and other solutions
shell, batch, and Perl scripting
virtualization software including VMware and/or Hyper-V
cloud computing programs including Amazon EC2 and/or Microsoft Azure
complex client/server and web-hosted application software
Experience with the interaction of Oracle solutions with the following disciplines or technologies is preferred:
storage technologies such as Storage Array Networks (SAN), Network Attached Storage (NAS), Direct Attached Storage (DAS) and RAID strategies governing data storage
LDAP solutions such as Active Directory, Novell eDirectory, and Apple Open Directory
enterprise backup systems and best practices
Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or other technical discipline, or experience commensurate with a four-year degree
One or more certifications indicating formal training and expertise with the design, analysis, deployment, integration, optimization, troubleshooting, and consultation of Oracle databases and related solutions is desired
Skills/knowledge/abilities
Ability to act as a subject matter expert before, during, and after service fulfilment
Ability to lead or direct projects by accurately scoping responsibilities, estimating level of effort, assessing outcomes, and mitigating risk
Ability to work independently to understand, communicate, and resolve business problems in situations where little or no supervision, standardization, or information exists
Ability to work within a fast-paced, dynamic, and demanding environment
Ability to work concurrently on projects of varying size/scope, complexity, and duration
Significant ability to manage difficult customers with complex or challenging demands
Proficient in the use of software such as Microsoft Office, CRM, and remote conferencing
Ability to foster and maintain an effective relationship with colleagues, customers, and vendors
Ability to dependably complete reporting in a very timely and accurate manner
Ability to anticipate, recognize, mitigate, and resolve potential problems with rigorous decisions and solutions consistent with organizational goals
Ability to convey information and ideas clearly, concisely, and persuasively using terminology and jargon appropriate for the intended audience
Ability to apply expertise to address the needs and challenges of the education industry, public and private sector education providers, and PowerSchool customers

Work independently with little supervision on day to day tasks, receiving general instructions on new assignments

Knowledge of DataBases Systems installation, configuration and hardening management
Knowledge of system admin, mid level for Linux/Windows operating systems.
Knowledge of DataBase servers: Informix, Oracle, M.S. Sqlserver, postgresSQL, etc..

Job Description:
Database Management: Design, implement, and maintain Microsoft SQL Server databases, ensuring optimal performance, security, and availability.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and tune database performance by analyzing query execution plans, optimizing indexes, and configuring server settings.
Backup and Recovery: Develop and implement backup and recovery strategies to protect the integrity and availability of data, including regular data backups, restoration, and disaster recovery planning.
Security Management: Implement and maintain database security protocols, including user access controls, data encryption, and data masking, to protect sensitive information.
Database Monitoring: Monitor and troubleshoot database issues, identify performance bottlenecks, and proactively take corrective actions to ensure continuous system availability.
Capacity Planning: Analyze database growth patterns and forecast future database capacity requirements, recommending appropriate hardware and software upgrades to support business needs.
Database Documentation: Create and maintain technical documentation, including database schemas, configurations, and operational procedures, to ensure accurate system knowledge transfer and compliance.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, system administrators, and network engineers, to support application development, deployment, and integration efforts.
Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in database management, recommending and implementing process enhancements and automation to improve operational efficiency.
Troubleshooting and Support: Respond to and resolve database-related incidents and service requests, providing timely and effective support to internal stakeholders.
Requirements:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Proven experience as a Microsoft SQL Server DBA, managing enterprise-level database systems.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, including database design, administration, performance tuning, and troubleshooting.
Experience with database backup and recovery strategies, including disaster recovery planning and implementation.
Proficiency in SQL programming and scripting languages.
Familiarity with database security concepts and best practices.
Understanding of high availability (HA) and failover clustering technologies.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex database issues.
Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Preferred Qualifications:
Microsoft SQL Server certification (eg, MCSA, MCSE) or equivalent industry certifications.
Experience with cloud-based database platforms, such as Microsoft Azure SQL Database.
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and technologies.
Knowledge of PowerShell or other automation tools for database administration tasks.
Experience with performance monitoring and tuning tools, such as SQL Server Profiler or Extended Events.
Keywords: SQL Server Database Administrator, SAN, Performance tuning, Database design, MySQL, Application development, Oracle, Open source, MCSE, Information technology

Job Description:
Are you seeking a purposeful and rewarding Database Administrator career opportunity
Our IT Operations team is growing in India, and with big ambitions and a clear vision for the future, now is the time to join Clario!
What we offer:
Competitive compensation
Attractive benefits (security, flexibility, support and well-being)
Engaging employee programs
Great office location and facilities in Basavanagudi, Bangalore.
What youll be doing:
Ensure operation and maintenance of all Clario databases (SQL) supported by IT Operations in 24x7x365 environment. Scheduling and monitoring of database backup scripts, creation and management of database instances, data migration and upgrades. Maintain a high level of Customer Satisfaction in all aspects of Incident Management. Ensure system uptime and performance meets or exceeds business defined Service Level Agreements.
Responsible for the creation and management of database instances. This includes tasks such as user creation, creating and altering table spaces, configuring listeners and creating and managing rollback segments.
Responsible for the daily backup and data export of all database instances including hot backups and cold backups.
Document and execute changes on Production and non-Production environments, including (but not limited to) database configuration changes, database patches, and software updates.
Collaborate with Validation and RD Teams in support of the SDLC. Escalate issues to appropriate teams. Provide notification of scheduled releases to business stakeholders. Support developers with special database requests such as replication, configuration, archiving of data and database snapshots
Follow industry Best Practice and Guidelines to ensure that Database design and configurations are optimal. Minimize risks to system availability and security. Report all potential risks, operational failures, time constraint problems and extraordinary events that will negatively impact to the supervisor.
Perform Incident Management duties including (but not limited to) responding to operational help desk calls and tickets entered in Service Desk Management. This is primarily for database issues but will at times pertain to general system issues. Take appropriate action to resolve and/or escalate when necessary. Provide timely and accurate responses to maintain high levels of Customer Satisfaction.
Works as a technical resource for IT Projects and Product Management initiatives. Provide technical guidance, oversight, and status updates.
Report all potential risks, operational failures, time constraint problems and extraordinary events that could impact customers.
Performs tasks in accordance with IT and Corporate Standard Operating Procedures.
Perform after hours maintenance and/or on-call duties as needed.
What were looking for:
College/University degree or equivalent work experience.
Expert knowledge of SQL database administration including (but not limited to) installation, management, troubleshooting, patching, upgrading, and tuning.
Expert knowledge of SQL database backups, and recovery / restores.
Knowledge of systems used to monitor performance and availability of SQL databases, such as SQL Diagnostic Manager and Idera.
Experienced in redundant database design, using technologies such as Microsoft Clustering and Database Mirroring. Experience with technologies such as Transcactional Log Shipping for use in failover and Disaster Recovery situations.
High level of proficiency in Windows Operating Systems required.
Demonstrated experience in scripting for task automation.
Understanding of basic project management, such as project planning and time management.
Strong interpersonal skills needed to effectively communicate with customers and business stakeholders.
Strong troubleshooting skills and ability to perform root cause analysis.
Ability to understand and adapt to Clario s IT environment. Stay current with IT technologies and industry trends.
Keywords: Scheduling, Project planning, Project SQL, Windows, Troubleshooting, microsoft, IT operations, Incident Monitoring

Job Description:
A Cassandra DBA (Database Administrator) is responsible for the administration, maintenance, and optimization of Cassandra databases within an organization
They play a crucial role in ensuring the availability, performance, and scalability of the Cassandra database environment
Here is a general job description for a Cassandra DBA:
Responsibilities:
Database Administration: Install, configure, and maintain Cassandra database clusters in both development and production environments
Manage database schemas, tables, indexes, and user permissions
Perform database backups, recovery, and restoration activities
Performance Monitoring and Tuning: Monitor the performance and health of Cassandra clusters
Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks, slow queries, and resource utilization issues
Optimize database configurations, query performance, and data modeling for improved efficiency and scalability
Capacity Planning: Monitor database growth and plan for future capacity needs
Estimate storage requirements and work with infrastructure teams to ensure adequate resources are provisioned
Scale up or scale out the database infrastructure as needed to accommodate data growth
Data Replication and High Availability: Configure and manage Cassandra replication strategies to ensure data availability and durability
Implement data replication across multiple data centers and handle replication challenges, such as consistency and latency
Security and Access Control: Implement and enforce database security measures, including authentication, authorization, and encryption
Set up user roles and permissions to control access to databases and data
Regularly review and update security configurations to address emerging threats and vulnerabilities
Database Monitoring and Alerting: Set up database monitoring tools to proactively identify performance issues, errors, and anomalies
Create and configure alerts to notify relevant teams of critical database events
Respond to database alerts and take appropriate actions to resolve issues
Keywords: Access control, Resource utilization, Monitoring tools, Data modeling, cassandra, database security, Database administration, Database Administrator, Performance monitoring, Capacity planning

Job Description:
Equal Opportunity Employer
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets

Job Title: Senior Database Administrator
Job Location: Bengaluru, Karnataka
Work Arrangement: Hybrid (3 days per week in office)
Shifts: Rotational Shifts

Job Purpose:
The successful candidate will be a production database administration competency in our News Technology Services - Database Infrastructure team and will take ownership of supporting the NewsCorp affiliate company databases including administration, performance, reliability and security of data in a core database competency.
For this role you will show expertise in one or more Dow Jones core database technologies listed below with an aptitude to develop skills in other core Dow Jones database technologies and assist the team to develop their non-core skills in your core competency.
The MySQL/Aurora Database administrator will need a detailed understanding of the applications supported by his/her core competency and be expected to be proactive in detecting potential issues and to raise any concerns and service improvement suggestions with Offshore Database Manager.
As part of the Database team, the candidate will also offer a wealth of experience across the Enterprise, with knowledge of other Infrastructure technologies such as Windows, Linux, Ethernet and Fiber Channel Networking.
Backup technologies CommVault and NetWorker are a plus.

Accountabilities and Responsibilities
Responsible for, but not limited to, the following;
Database architecture & Design
Performance tuning & Monitoring
HA, Clustering, Replication
Backup Solutions
Amazon AWS Databases
Troubleshooting system and network performance problems
Core competency on MySQL/Aurora/PostgreSQL.
Minimum of 5-7 years of experience working with MySQL, Aurora, MariaDB, Percona databases and/or other databases.
Minimum 4+ years of experience with AWS RDS. (Aurora, MySQL, PostgreSQL, DynamoDB and Redshift etc.)
Should possess strong architecture knowledge and concepts of infrastructure and databases.
Should have reasonable understanding of network, security and access concepts on the cloud (AWS) such as VPC, security groups, NACL s, bastion servers etc.
Should possess strong security concepts and data protection strategies including encryption and fine grained access controls.
Implement proper security and access controls and keep the databases patched for security vulnerabilities.
Should have sufficient knowledge of hardware and software load balancers.
Must be familiar with all replication technology: master- master, master-slave, circular etc.
Should support/Administer i.e. manage, maintain and monitor Aurora databases in AWS and on-prem MySQL databases.
Should have sound knowledge on the Cluster and parameter groups and CLI's.
Perform 24x7 advanced tier troubleshooting, including off hour maintenance and optimization activities, problem resolution, and on-call.
Possess a working knowledge of database internals including locks, waits, transaction consistency, data integrity, recovery paths etc.
Knowledge of containerization such as Docker or Kubernetes and EKS services would be a huge plus.
Must have performed MySQL/Aurora (cloud) database upgrades and patching with minimum downtime (rolling upgrades/patches).
Should have experience in migrating on-prem MySQL databases to RDS using different methods like DMS, Replication etc.
Should have worked directly with developers and engineers to review database models and design, indexes and queries.
Perform database backups and recovery.
Must know techniques of backing up tables, databases, utilities for backup and restoring them to a point-in-time or restore a master.
Design and build Disaster Recovery strategies

Additional Knowledge
Windows & Linux operating systems
Working knowledge of networking, routing and VLANs
Working knowledge of Cloud technologies Amazon Web Services.
Good understanding of Internet based technologies: TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP, and SMTP
Service Management tools ServiceNow.
Understanding of industry leading monitoring tools
Practical experience in monitoring and tuning infrastructure to provide a highly available service
Strong understanding of enterprise architecture, system availability and disaster recovery
Work proactively with 3rd parties to identify opportunities to enhance the service and effectiveness of those Services

Person Specification:
You are a multi-skilled database administrator, preferably with exposure to a variety of database vendors. You also have a broad set of IT skills gained over a minimum 5 years working in an enterprise IT organization. You are experienced in implementing; securing, supporting and upgrading enterprise infrastructure, ensuring the infrastructure, which runs corporate applications, are correctly monitored and highly available as required.
Essential skills
Able to work in a fast paced environment.
Able to demonstrate flexibility, adaptability, motivation, as well as excellent problem solving capability.
Strong time and task management skills
Ideally educated to degree level, with a strong technical and service management background.
ITIL certification or other service management framework experience, including working with ITIL Service processes and functions such as Change, Incident, Problem and Transition.
Strong customer management skills, including the ability to resolve disputes to mutual satisfaction.
Good documentation skills to present in any internal or external technical review forums
Good communication and report writing skills
Additional Requirements:
Ensure effective management of any outsourced services and functions through Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and contracts.
Respond to, and satisfactorily resolve, any escalated customer issues or concerns.
Work with other Technology teams to identify possible service improvements and implement these through the Change Management process.
Responsibility for working with the Service Owners on routine testing of backup, resiliency, and disaster recovery scenarios.
Work successfully with on and off shore team members to provide the best overall working structure.
Participate in a database on-call rotation for both planned work and unplanned service interruptions.

Key Relationships:
Infrastructure team
Service Delivery team
Application/Service Managers
3rd Party Support Partners
Transition Management
Problem Management
Incident Management
Change Management
Vendor Management
Project / Programme Managers

Unusual Challenges/Circumstances:
(e.g. a lot of travel, long or unusual hours of work, cover for others at short notice)
Must be prepared to respond to major incidents relating to infrastructure outages at short notice and outside of normal working hours.
Must be willing to work US EDT hours.
Must be prepared to work very early mornings to cover the change window.
Keywords: Servicenow, Aurora Mysql, Postgresql, Amazon Rds, MySQL Database Administration

Job Description:
Greenlight is looking for an experienced Senior DBA to own and manage our operational databases supporting our direct-to-consumer and SaaS products. In this role you will collaborate with our engineering teams to coordinate migrations, call out dependencies, and plan for releases.
What you will be doing:
Analyze solutions and implement best practices for PostgreSQL, MySQL and DynamoDB infrastructure.
Provide NoSQL/SQL development guidance to engineering and technical support teams.
Design, build and maintain core database infrastructure that allow Greenlight to scale.
Actively monitor databases for performance issues, and take steps to identify, document, and resolve them.
Pair with SRE team to roll out production changes and mitigate database-related production incidents.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data integration and synchronization across various systems.
Work on automation of database infrastructure and help engineering teams succeed by building self-service tooling.
Develop and maintain documentation including database schemas, configuration settings and standard operating procedures.
Facilitate and improve observability across database infrastructure and take proactive measures to prevent and resolve issues.
Perform capacity planning and forecasting to ensure adequate resources are available for current and future database needs.
Provide on-call support and facilitate database remediations resulting from incidents
Stay up to date with industry best practices, trends and emerging technologies related to database administration.

What you should bring:
5+ years of previous experience working as a DBA.
Experience managing mission critical highly transactional and distributed databases (MySQL preferred) in the cloud
Comfortable with rotational on-call support
Proficient in SQL development
Experience in troubleshooting and resolving database integrity issues, performance issues, blocking and deadlocking issues, replication and connectivity issues, etc
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work collaboratively within Infrastructure and across Engineering.
Experience in performance tuning, query optimization, and performance monitoring
Experience administering AWS RDS/Aurora, DynamoDB and/or Redis (AWS Elasticache)
Experience working with Terraform is a plus.
Keywords: Performance tuning, Automation, Postgresql, Analytical, MySQL, Database administration, Troubleshooting, Forecasting, Technical support, Capacity planning

The MS SQL DBA may also be responsible for troubleshooting and resolving database issues, and providing technical support to users

Strong technical knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, analytical skills

Job Description:
Job Description: Database Administrator (DBA)
Position Overview:
The Database Administrator (DBA) is responsible for the management, administration, and optimization of databases within an organization. The DBA ensures the integrity, security, availability, and performance of databases and collaborates with development and operations teams to support database-related requirements.
Responsibilities:
Database Design and Implementation:
Design, implement, and maintain database systems that meet business requirements.
Collaborate with application developers to define database schemas, tables, indexes, and relationships.
Ensure data integrity and consistency by establishing and enforcing data validation and quality control procedures.
Database Performance and Optimization:
Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient query execution and response times.
Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks through query tuning, index optimization, and database parameter tuning.
Conduct capacity planning and recommend hardware and software upgrades to support future growth.
Database Security and Compliance:
Implement and maintain database security controls to protect data from unauthorized access or breaches.
Ensure compliance with relevant data protection regulations and industry standards.
Perform regular security assessments, vulnerability scans, and database backups and recovery procedures.
Database Administration and Maintenance:
Install, configure, and upgrade database software and related tools.
Create and manage database instances, users, roles, permissions, and privileges.
Monitor database systems for errors, performance issues, and capacity constraints.
Perform routine maintenance tasks such as database backups, restores, and data archiving.
Database Backup, Recovery, and Disaster Planning:
Develop and implement database backup and recovery strategies to ensure data availability and business continuity.
Test backup and recovery procedures to validate their effectiveness.
Collaborate with IT teams to create and maintain disaster recovery plans for critical databases.
Keywords: Database Administration, Ms Sql Server Dba, Mssql Dba, MySQL Database Administration, Ms Sql Database

About Biz2Credit (read more at www.biz2x.com):
Founded in 2007, Biz2Credit is rated as the #1 small business financing resource in the U.S. by Entrepreneur Magazine. To-date, we've facilitated more than $2.2 billion in small business lending.
Biz2X is the technology that has helped Biz2Credit become the premier alternative lender for small businesses. It provides our clients a fully omnichannel experience with data and workflows that adapt seamlessly to their Core Banking systems.
The Biz2X Platform is backed by over twelve years of lending experience, the top tier data scientists, and billions in business funding processed globally. There's a reason why banks of all sizes trust Biz2X - from large multi-national brands & Financial Institutions like HSBC to growing banks like Popular Bank.
Biz2Credit today is one of the worlds Top Most Fintech, that is rated as #1 finance resource for SMEs in US and providing its AI-Powered Digital Banking platform (Biz2X) to leading banks worldwide. Biz2X is used by banks for Automating Lending. Optimizing Risk Management & Improving Efficiency.
Our Global Presence:
Biz2Credit is headquartered in New York City, (USA). With a well-established international presence outside the United States we maintain a network of offices serving our clients in Asia Pacific Regions, Canada, Australia etc.

Job Description:
A Microsoft SQL Server Database Administrator (MS SQL DBA) is responsible for managing and maintaining the performance, security, and availability of Microsoft SQL Server databases.
 This involves installing, configuring, and upgrading database software, designing and implementing database backup and recovery strategies, monitoring and tuning database performance, and ensuring data integrity and security.
The MS SQL DBA may also be responsible for troubleshooting and resolving database issues, and providing technical support to users. Additional responsibilities may include developing and implementing database policies and procedures, documenting database designs and configurations, and collaborating with developers to optimize database applications. Strong technical knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, analytical skills.

Job Description:
As a Senior SQL Server Database Administrator at nGenue, you will be an integral part of our technology team, responsible for the design, implementation, and management of our SQL Server databases. You will work collaboratively with nGenue team members and customers to ensure the optimal performance, availability, and security of our data infrastructure.

Role and Responsibilities:
Database Deployment and Configuration: Assist nGenue customers with the deployment, configuration, and troubleshooting of nGenue databases, providing valuable technical support.
Database Performance Optimization: Utilize your expertise to monitor, analyze, and tune database performance to guarantee seamless operations and rapid response times for nGenue customers.
Data Security and Integrity: Work with customers to implement robust security measures and ensure compliance with data protection regulations.
Database Design and Architecture: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement efficient database structures that cater to the evolving needs of our products.
Disaster Recovery Planning: Work with customers to develop and execute strategies for disaster recovery and data backup to minimize downtime and data loss in case of unexpected events.
Capacity Planning: Work with customers to forecast database growth and proactively manage capacity to accommodate increasing data demands.
Collaborative Leadership: Lead junior members of the database team, providing mentorship and guidance to foster their professional growth.

Preferred candidate profile
B.Tech in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field / MCA
Proven track record of at least 5 years in SQL Server database administration, with expertise in performance optimization, security, and backup strategies.
In-depth knowledge of SQL Server internals, high availability configurations (AlwaysOn, clustering), and disaster recovery solutions.
Strong experience with SQL scripting, query optimization, and troubleshooting.
Proficiency in monitoring and alerting tools for database performance and health.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Leadership experience or the ability to mentor and guide junior team members.
Keywords: SQL Server Administration, SSRS, SSIS, SQL Scripting

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Database Administrator (DBA) who can join our team in Chennai.
The ideal candidate will have a strong background in installing, configuring, and maintaining as well as excellent in database management and troubleshooting.
What will make you successful:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Masters degree is a plus
Proven experience as a Database Administrator or similar role
Proficiency in installing, configuring, and maintaining database management systems (e.g., Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server)
Strong knowledge of performance optimization, query tuning, and troubleshooting
Familiarity with backup and recovery strategies to ensure data protection
Experience in monitoring server health and implementing access controls
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
Effective communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams
Relevant certifications (e.g., Oracle Certified Professional, Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator) are advantageous
1. Database Installation, Configuration, and Maintenance:
Install and configure various database management systems (e.g., Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server) to ensure seamless operations
Regularly apply updates, patches, and version upgrades to maintain database security and functionality
Monitor databases to identify and rectify any issues related to installation and configuration
2. Performance Optimization:
Analyze database performance metrics to identify areas for improvement
Optimize queries, indexes, and database configurations for enhanced query response times
Implement caching and other strategies to maximize database efficiency
3. Troubleshooting and Data Integrity:
Diagnose and resolve database-related issues promptly, ensuring minimal downtime
Perform data validation and implement measures to maintain data integrity and consistency
Collaborate with developers to troubleshoot and optimize database-related code
4. Backup and Recovery:
Develop and execute robust backup and recovery strategies to safeguard critical data
Regularly perform data backups and conduct recovery drills to ensure readiness for any unforeseen events
5. Server Health Monitoring:
Monitor database server health and performance metrics to proactively address potential issues
Identify and rectify resource utilization problems to maintain optimal server performance
6. User Access and Security:
Manage user access permissions and roles to ensure data security and compliance
Implement and enforce security protocols to protect sensitive information
7. Collaboration and Development Support:
Collaborate with development teams to provide database support and optimize database-related code
Participate in design and architecture discussions to ensure efficient database operations
8. DR Drills Planning:
Develop and maintain disaster recovery (DR) plans, including conducting regular DR drills
Ensure data availability and minimize downtime during disaster recovery scenarios
Keywords: MySQL, Consulting, Disaster recovery, Oracle, microsoft, Troubleshooting, Information technology, Monitoring, SQL, Recruitment

Job Description:
Responsible for managing and optimizing the database infrastructure including setup, configuration, security, backups, monitoring and performance tuning. Supports data governance, integrity and regulatory compliance requirements.
Database Administrator
We are seeking a Database Administrator to manage the database infrastructure for our health claim management solution. You will set up, configure, optimize, audit and disaster recover database environments, including NoSQL databases (MongoDB) and SQL databases (PostgreSQL).
Ensure availability, integrity, security, optimal performance, compliance and sustainability of mission-critical data used across the solution while minimizing risks and costs.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with architects, developers, business analysts and information security teams to understand data requirements, schemas, relationships, queries, reports, integrations, policies and key metrics. Determine appropriate database technologies (document DBs, wide-column stores, key-value stores, etc.) and configurations to meet needs securely and sustainably.
Install, configure, monitor and optimize database instances on-premises or on cloud infrastructure (AWS RDS, Azure DB, GCP Dedicated Hosts). Setup high availability for production databases with replication, multi-AZ deployment and failover.
Administer user access, activity monitoring, security, auditing and permissions for database accounts and roles. Enforce policies including authentication, authorization, encryption, access control, audit trails and anomaly detection. Prevent unauthorized access or malicious activity.
Provide disaster recovery through backup scripts, replication, cloud disaster recovery and business continuity planning. Recover databases rapidly and accurately in the event of outages or corruptions.
Migrate databases between on-premises and cloud environments or different technologies (MongoDB to SQL, etc.) while minimizing downtime and data loss. Conduct impact analyses, planning and testing to ensure a successful migration.
Keywords: Performance tuning, NoSQL, Information security, Postgresql, Disaster recovery, Business continuity planning, MongoDB, Database Administrator, SQL, Auditing

Job Description:
The Oracle Database Administrator is responsible for configuring, administering, and maintaining the Oracle databases in the AWS cloud environment
Responsibilities include database upgrades, patching, security, troubleshooting and issue resolution, backup procedures, and performance tuning
In addition, application DBA s will provide support and direction to developers and other support personnel as needed
Daily responsibilities include monitoring the production environment, providing acceptable system performance, and assuring data is protected and recoverable as required and assuring data is protected and recoverable as required
Key Responsibilities
Formulate and monitor policies, procedures and standards relating to database management.
Provide design standards and guidance for projects and technical roadmaps.
Capacity Planning: Forecast future database growth based on usage trends and plan for hardware and storage requirements accordingly to ensure scalability and optimal performance.
Patch Management and Upgrades: Plan and execute SQL Server software upgrades, patches, and service packs. Stay up-to-date with the latest SQL Server releases and features.
Troubleshooting and Issue Resolution: Investigate and resolve complex database-related issues, including data corruption, performance problems, and connectivity challenges.
Automation and Scripting: Develop automation scripts and tools to streamline repetitive tasks, improve efficiency, and reduce the risk of human errors.
Monitoring and Alerting: Set up monitoring and alerting systems to proactively identify and address potential database issues before they become critical.
Compliance and Best Practices: Ensure that databases comply with industry standards and internal policies. Follow best practices for database management, security, and performance optimization.
Mentoring and Training: Provide guidance and support to Level 1 and Level 2 DBAs, sharing knowledge and expertise to foster their professional growth.
Performance Analysis and Reporting: Generate performance reports and analysis for stakeholders and management to provide insights into the database environments health and performance.
Documentation: Maintain up-to-date documentation of database configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps.
Vendor and Third-Party Tool Management: Evaluate and manage third-party tools and solutions that assist in database management, monitoring, and performance tuning. Resolve locking conflicts/blocking and resource utilization. Build tools for customers and internal teams by creating scripts or using software to automate administration tasks and DBA processes.
Consult with customers on SQL Server including best practices and SQL Server Disaster Recovery setups.
Participate in sales implementations vendor calls to provide advanced knowledge in the purchase of software, hardware or services that can be used to improve the performance of the database server. Carry out disaster recovery planning and execution including, log shipping, mirroring, replication, and AlwaysOn.
Works with the product organization to assist in the roll out of new products.
Participate in 24X7 production support for SQL Server infrastructure
Executes large sized, complex database projects. Ensures projects are properly documented.
Knowledge
Good understanding of Oracle database concepts and structures on various in-house and cloud platforms.
Oracle database skills and Unix operating system understanding is required.
Good Knowledge of architecture and configuration of latest Oracle versions.
Good experience of patching, cloning, security, backup and recovery procedures, node addition, deletion, replication setup and DR-Drill activities.
Good understanding of Performance Tuning, Query Optimization, Client/Server Connectivity.
Experience of implementing operational automation using Ansible playbooks or any other tools.
Experience of Pluggable and container databases.
Experience of writing shell scripts as well as knowledge in general system administration tasks.
Experience of setting up Oracle high availability [RAC, Dataguard] environment using various tools.
Experience of database administration, development, maintenance, and production support.
Experience of managing Oracle databases on various cloud environments like AWS.
Experience of identifying performance problems and optimization of database performance.
Experience on planning and Performing optimal Backup and Recovery solutions.
Good knowledge of RAC, ASM, RMAN, Dataguard, Datapump and other Oracle utilities.
Good understanding of SQL and PLSQL Procedures, Functions, triggers.
Good in providing guidance to the development team in optimizing SQL statements.
Proficient in performing the recovery of the Oracle database files in various recovery scenarios.
Desired
Experience working with Postgresql /MySQL
Database Specialty Certifications in AWS id preferred.
Experience working in AWS cloud environments
Keywords: Performance tuning, Automation, Production support, Postgresql, MySQL, Troubleshooting, RMAN, SQL, System administration

Job Description:
Oracle Database Administrator
Our Team
As a member of the Support organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customer needs. This involves resolving post-sales non-technical customer inquiries via phone and electronic means, as well as technical questions regarding the use of and troubleshooting of our Electronic Support Services. As a primary point of contact for customers, you are responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues.
As a Senior Systems Engineer, you will interface with the customer's IT staff on a regular basis. Either at the client's site or from a remote location, you will be responsible for the resolution of moderately complex technical problems related to the installation, recommended maintenance and use, and repair/workarounds for Oracle products. You should be highly experienced in some Oracle products and several platforms that are being supported. You will be expected to work with only general guidance from management while advising management on progress/status.
Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May have project lead role. Because of substantial customer interfacing, a demonstrated ability to work with customers on an independent basis with exceptional communication skills, while consistently achieving the highest levels of customer satisfaction is essential. A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent experience is preferred with five years of related experience. Experience with Oracle's core products, applications, and tools is important.
Responsibilities:
Minimum 8 Years of relevant experience as Oracle Database engineer/DBA and 2+ Years of Exadata Administrator experience. Experience in day-to-day Exadata DMA activities like:
Increase or decrease CPU Core count on compute node
Provide support for hardware failures(i.e.dimm/cpu/hdd) on Exadata racks
Shutdown or reboot cell without impacting ASM
Run exachk, sosreport, sundiag and ilom snapshots to diagnose Exadata health check
Clearing correctable memory errors from faultmgmt shell
Experience in Exadata configuration activities like:
ASR configuration and addressing ILOM incidents
Experience in installation of new Exadata setup using OEDA and Reimage compute nodes
Experience in ILOM administration, Storage (ZDLRA, ZFS, etc) administration, and Exadata Full stack patching.
Experience in OCI/ExaCC/ExaCS or any other engineered system like Supercluster is an added advantage.
Good understanding of Server, Storage, and Networking infrastructure.
Good understanding of Linux Server operating system and troubleshooting.
Extensive knowledge and solid troubleshooting experience in the following areas:
RAC, ASM, Performance tuning, Data Guard (Physical and Logical), DG Broker
Experience in handling complex database recovery scenarios
Experience in database migrations and upgrades
Experience in troubleshooting various installation and patching issues
Experience in Golden Gate replication
Oracle Enterprise Manager - Cloud Control / Grid Control
Experience in any scripting language like Python, Shell, Perl, etc is an added advantage
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work under pressure - quick thinking and remaining calm during stressful situations
Willingness to work in 24x7 rotational shifts and on weekends
Ability to quickly grasp complex technical issues
Appetite to learn new technologies and constantly improve technical skills.
Provide SME level of support whenever the scenario exists.
Diversity and Inclusion:
An Oracle career can span industries, roles, Countries and cultures, giving you the opportunity to flourish in new roles and innovate, while blending work life in. Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry.
In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation. .
Oracle offers a highly competitive suite of Employee Benefits designed on the principles of parity, consistency, and affordability. The overall package includes certain core elements such as Medical, Life Insurance, access to Retirement Planning, and much more. We also encourage our employees to engage in the culture of giving back to the communities where we live and do business.
At Oracle, we believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. Job Description:
Oracle Database Administrator
Our Team
As a member of the Support organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customer needs. This involves resolving post-sales non-technical customer inquiries via phone and electronic means, as well as technical questions regarding the use of and troubleshooting of our Electronic Support Services. As a primary point of contact for customers, you are responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues.
As a Senior Systems Engineer, you will interface with the customer's IT staff on a regular basis. Either at the client's site or from a remote location, you will be responsible for the resolution of moderately complex technical problems related to the installation, recommended maintenance and use, and repair/workarounds for Oracle products. You should be highly experienced in some Oracle products and several platforms that are being supported. You will be expected to work with only general guidance from management while advising management on progress/status.
Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May have project lead role. Because of substantial customer interfacing, a demonstrated ability to work with customers on an independent basis with exceptional communication skills, while consistently achieving the highest levels of customer satisfaction is essential. A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent experience is preferred with five years of related experience. Experience with Oracle's core products, applications, and tools is important.
Responsibilities:
Minimum 8 Years of relevant experience as Oracle Database engineer/DBA and 2+ Years of Exadata Administrator experience. Experience in day-to-day Exadata DMA activities like:
Increase or decrease CPU Core count on compute node
Provide support for hardware failures(i.e.dimm/cpu/hdd) on Exadata racks
Shutdown or reboot cell without impacting ASM
Run exachk, sosreport, sundiag and ilom snapshots to diagnose Exadata health check
Clearing correctable memory errors from faultmgmt shell
Experience in Exadata configuration activities like:
ASR configuration and addressing ILOM incidents
Experience in installation of new Exadata setup using OEDA and Reimage compute nodes
Experience in ILOM administration, Storage (ZDLRA, ZFS, etc) administration, and Exadata Full stack patching.
Experience in OCI/ExaCC/ExaCS or any other engineered system like Supercluster is an added advantage.
Good understanding of Server, Storage, and Networking infrastructure.
Good understanding of Linux Server operating system and troubleshooting.
Extensive knowledge and solid troubleshooting experience in the following areas:
RAC, ASM, Performance tuning, Data Guard (Physical and Logical), DG Broker
Experience in handling complex database recovery scenarios
Experience in database migrations and upgrades
Experience in troubleshooting various installation and patching issues
Experience in Golden Gate replication
Oracle Enterprise Manager - Cloud Control / Grid Control
Experience in any scripting language like Python, Shell, Perl, etc is an added advantage
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work under pressure - quick thinking and remaining calm during stressful situations
Willingness to work in 24x7 rotational shifts and on weekends
Ability to quickly grasp complex technical issues
Appetite to learn new technologies and constantly improve technical skills.
Provide SME level of support whenever the scenario exists.
Diversity and Inclusion:
An Oracle career can span industries, roles, Countries and cultures, giving you the opportunity to flourish in new roles and innovate, while blending work life in. Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry.
In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation. .
Oracle offers a highly competitive suite of Employee Benefits designed on the principles of parity, consistency, and affordability. The overall package includes certain core elements such as Medical, Life Insurance, access to Retirement Planning, and much more. We also encourage our employees to engage in the culture of giving back to the communities where we live and do business.
At Oracle, we believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to successfully participate in the job application, interview process, and in potential roles. to perform crucial job functions.
Thats why weÂre committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. ItÂs when everyoneÂs voice is heard and valued that weÂre inspired to go beyond whatÂs been done before.

Responsibilities:
Design, develop, implement and maintain our core Oracle database applications.

Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced Oracle Database Administrator to join our IT team. As an Oracle DBA, you will be responsible for maintaining the performance, integrity, and security of our Oracle database systems. Your expertise will be critical in ensuring the availability and reliability of our databases to support the organization s operations and applications.
Responsibilities:
Work with a team that supports large number of Oracle databases.
Participate in management, prioritization, minor enhancements / fix activities, problem management, stability analysis, etc.
To be proactive in nature thus identifying problems in advance and looking for continuous service improvements.
Min 10+ years of experience in Oracle database administration in production environments on Unix, Windows and Linux OS.
Capable of performing Database Administration tasks independently in Oracle 10g, 11g, 12c and 19c.
Analysis of technical issues and permanent fix/solution.
Implementation of RAC, ASM, Data Guard for database failover between Data center and DR site, perform switchover /failover activities.
Work on the performance issues related to Clustering, Create logical diagrams to figure out the loop pools in the database designs and functionality.
Diagnose and resolve performance, connectivity, security and database corruption issues in a critical production environment.
All above applicable to infrastructure which has standalone and RAC databases using file-system based or ASM based storage.
Provide capacity planning and performance monitoring of our database environments.
Support, administer and maintain production and non-production database environments.
Implement and maintain proactive database monitoring.
Work with engineering and application support teams to identify, triage and resolve performance issues. This requires the ability to analyze, optimize and tune complex SQL queries.
Deploy and maintain high availability and failover technologies such as Active Data Guard, RAC.
Create, clone and upgrade database environments to support implementation activities.
Define, implement and support database backup and recovery policies using RMAN and/or storage replication technologies.
Working knowledge of ITIL processes.
Perform database restoration and recovery in the event of a failure.
Ensure sensitive data is appropriately protected via industry standard encryption solutions.
Contribute to, and update, systems documentation as required.
Participate in providing 24 7 support on rotational basis to ensure operations of these critical systems for different customers.
Must Have:
Must have implemented and supported mission critical systems providing 24X7 support.
Must have excellent shell scripting skills.
Must have proven experience in tuning databases and queries.
Can drive projects to get the projects accomplished with superior results.
Must deliver winning results and take accountability for your actions.
Must be an expert in diagnosing and solving complex problems.
Must have very good oral and written communication skills and have the ability to influence others.
Must have 10+ years of Oracle database related work experience.
Must have a BS or MS in Business, Computer Sciences, Engineering or related field (an equivalent combination of related education, training and experience may be considered).
Deep understanding of Oracle DBMS 11.2,12c and 19C.
Must have a deep understanding of Oracle Grid/RAC, Oracle Partitioning, Oracle CIS Security Standards, Oracle Enterprise Manager
Must understand Oracle performance tuning techniques.
Deep understanding of database replication using the following technologies: Oracle Active Data Guard, Oracle Golden Gate related data replication products.
Significant experience with HP-UX, Linux (RHEL).
Requirements:
Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven work experience as an Oracle Database Administrator or a similar role.
Strong knowledge of Oracle database management, SQL, and PL/SQL programming.
Experience with Oracle Enterprise Manager and other database monitoring tools.
In-depth understanding of database backup and recovery strategies.
Solid understanding of database security concepts and best practices.
Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot database-related issues effectively.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Oracle certifications (e.g., Oracle Certified Professional) are a plus.
Keywords: Unix, Application support, Linux, Shell scripting, Database administration, Oracle DBA, PLSQL, Windows, Oracle, Oracle 10G
