Job Description:
Database Administrators are responsible for understanding, configuring, and managing database administration tools
-Provides database support for business applications and schedules back up jobs for user databases
-Provides access control (password resets /account creation/deletion) and checks IP compliance (violation report review, compliance updates and compliance set ups)
-Performs data purging and data replication activities
-Researches on connectivity issues and recurring errors in Application database
-Responds to database alerts and takes appropriate actions
-Provides 24x7 support
-Performs database creations
-Performs performance tuning and troubleshooting for database
-Performs application database maintenance and provides technical assistance to users
-Manages database account access and database object changes
-Ensures that monitoring and alerts are properly in place to meet monitoring requirements
-Performs database recovery from logs, hot & cold backups, Export/Imports and Disaster Recovery
-Performs database creation decommissioning and database updates/migrations to a higher/lower version or cross platform migrations
Also involved in database, schema, and object refresh activities
-Monitors and reports existing database Instance, Database, Server activities for CPU, Memory, and Cach, logs performance, and recommends effective resource utilization/emergency recovery procedures Plans, schedules, and implements operating system software installs and patches (including 3rd party tools) using change management and release management processes
-Implements database security and auditing features and periodic reviews
Conducts root cause analysis for repeated incidents
-implements and performs configuration management of database cluster and replications
Skill Requirements:
8+ years of Oracle DBA experience
Experience in Oracle Golden Gate, Oracle Datagaurd and Oracle RAC is must
Experience in Oracle 11g, 12c, 19c
Should have a strong understanding of Oracle Database Concepts, Installation, Patching, Cloning and System Administration work.
Should be able to perform DBA activities like instance tuning, schema management, space management, backup and recovery, disaster recovery, database refresh
Should have good experience to performance tuning
Setting up and monitoring database alerts through OEM / CRONTAB.
Setting up & Monitoring Replication (Oracle GoldenGate).
Setting up, Monitoring & troubleshooting Dataguard & RAC.
User management
Space management
SQL tuning
Backup and Recovery
Troubleshooting end-to-end database issues in a RAC environment
Performance tuning of the Oracle database itself - especially in RAC configurations
Tuning of SQL performance, with emphasis on reducing disk IO and total query execution time
Specifying and creating partitioned tables and their indexes; migrating heap-organized tables to partitioned tables online
Configuring Oracle Enterprise Manager in a large, production environment; creating User-defined Metrics, managing and deploying monitoring templates based on database attributes, using emcli to effect mass changes efficiently
Configuring and managing Oracle Data Guard physical standby database environments which include FarSync and multiple sites
Disaster Recovery Management
Behavioral Skills:
Excellent verbal, presentation, communication, and critical thinking skills.
Strong analytical, problem solving, organizational and planning skills.

Job Description:
Role & responsibilities

1. Manage, Redesign and Modularize existing data model as necessary.
2. Peer program with developers in SQL Tuning and assisting them with appropriate design / solution with respect to database calls.
3. Day to day monitoring, debugging, and troubleshooting database issues.

5. Propose better DB designs and solutions to cater day to day production concerns.
6. Provide expert advice on SQL, relational databases, and data modelling.
7. Manage data replication for QA and Data Analytics
8. Voluntarily audit the query plan and suggest improvements.
9. Create Scheduled Event and Store Procedure to perform DB activities.

11. Performance tuning especially tuning complex queries, partitioning and indexing strategies.
12. Designing and implementing new features in a highly scalable and maintainable manner
13. Ensure that significant database design decisions are communicated, validated, and adhered to.Train and mentor junior developers.

Database Administrator

We are looking for highly capable, self-motivated, and independent Database Administrators based in India. If you are passionate about Oracle database technology as well as cloud computing, this is the ideal role youve been waiting for.

Our DBA team supports databases that are available both on-premise and on Cloud. In this role, you will be asked to organize and manage the Database instances to meet our objectives and maintain the highest customer satisfaction that is possible.

To ensure success as a DBA, you should possess extensive knowledge of Oracle database architecture, as well as experience in a similar role.
